Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories

Job Description

Day-to-day life


Design, develop, and deploy data solutions (think databases, pipelines, and warehouses) – tailor-made for clients
Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions and through complex data challenges
help junior colleagues become data masters and foster a culture of continuous learning
Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform and continue to develop your expertise
Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions


Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube

Qualifications

We're looking for a data virtuoso with five years of proven experience in designing, developing, and deploying databases, data pipelines, and data warehouses. You'll be a cloud champion who understands data warehousing concepts, setups, and design patterns within the Google Cloud Platform. As a coding mastermind, you'll possess strong SQL and Python or Java skills and a passion for exploring new technologies.

Excellent communication is key – you'll build relationships with clients, translate their needs into actionable solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. Finally, you're a team player at heart, thriving in collaborative environments where you can share knowledge, mentor others, and foster a culture of open communication and support.

Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?


Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

Benefits


Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
A modern office in central Stockholm.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.


Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page

Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Lead Data Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

Title: Analytics Utvecklare
Description:
Hos oss får du chansen att använda data för att förbättra beslutsfattande – på riktigt. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor, nyfikna kunder och drivna säljare bygger du lösningar som gör skillnad. Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och skapa värde genom datadrivna insikter – kanske är du vår nästa stjärna?


Analytics utvecklare på Advania 🚀

Du är en självklar medlem i vårt gäng  för att  stötta både nya och befintliga kunder i deras resa mot att bli mer datadrivna –  vi omvandlar data till insikter som gör verksamheten effektivare och besluten bättre.

Du arbetar nära kunden, ofta  i deras miljö, där du får vara med och skapa nyutveckling, vidareutveckla befintliga lösningar samt bidra till förvaltningen.

Det innebär bland annat att du hjälper kunden med:

Förstudier och behovsanalys
Införande och vidareutveckling av lösningar
Framtagning av rapporter anpassade efter kundens verksamhet och mål
Framtagning av lösningsspecifikationer och tydlig dokumentation



Utöver det ser vi gärna att du är med och bidrar till teamets utveckling – både tekniskt och socialt. Vi gillar att testa nya tekniker, arbetssätt och idéer, och uppmuntrar dig att dela med dig av allt du kan eller hittar som kan inspirera resten av teamet.


Vad vi söker hos dig ✨

Som person motiveras du av att hjälpa kunder att nå deras mål och lite till. Du gillar utmaningar men vågar fråga när du kört fast. Du trivs i en miljö där du får jobba självständigt inom ett team, är drivande och vill dela med dig av dina erfarenheter.

Du har en bakgrund inom BI, IT och systemutveckling och arbetar idag i en roll som har fokus på att utveckla BI-rapporter antingen front-end eller back-end eller så sitter du med verksamhetens krav på vad rapporterna ska fylla för syfte.

Vi söker dig som har:


Några års arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla lösningar inom Data Analytics och BI


En bakgrund inom BI eller dataanlytics


Erfarenhet av antingen frontend- eller backendutveckling – eller både och


Vana av att arbeta med kundens krav och behov


Några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom utveckling av Data Analytics och BI-lösningar.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋

Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.

Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.

Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.

Show more

Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och skapa värde genom datadrivna insikter – kanske är du vår nästa stjärna?

Analytics utvecklare på Advania 🚀

Du är en självklar medlem i vårt gäng  för att  stötta både nya och befintliga kunder i deras resa mot att bli mer datadrivna –  vi omvandlar data till insikter som gör verksamheten effektivare och besluten bättre.

Du arbetar nära kunden, ofta  i deras miljö, där du får vara med och skapa nyutveckling, vidareutveckla befintliga lösningar samt bidra till förvaltningen.

Det innebär bland annat att du hjälper kunden med:

  • Förstudier och behovsanalys
  • Införande och vidareutveckling av lösningar
  • Framtagning av rapporter anpassade efter kundens verksamhet och mål
  • Framtagning av lösningsspecifikationer och tydlig dokumentation

Utöver det ser vi gärna att du är med och bidrar till teamets utveckling – både tekniskt och socialt. Vi gillar att testa nya tekniker, arbetssätt och idéer, och uppmuntrar dig att dela med dig av allt du kan eller hittar som kan inspirera resten av teamet.

Vad vi söker hos dig ✨

Som person motiveras du av att hjälpa kunder att nå deras mål och lite till. Du gillar utmaningar men vågar fråga när du kört fast. Du trivs i en miljö där du får jobba självständigt inom ett team, är drivande och vill dela med dig av dina erfarenheter.

Du har en bakgrund inom BI, IT och systemutveckling och arbetar idag i en roll som har fokus på att utveckla BI-rapporter antingen front-end eller back-end eller så sitter du med verksamhetens krav på vad rapporterna ska fylla för syfte.

Vi söker dig som har:

  • Några års arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla lösningar inom Data Analytics och BI

  • En bakgrund inom BI eller dataanlytics

  • Erfarenhet av antingen frontend- eller backendutveckling – eller både och

  • Vana av att arbeta med kundens krav och behov

  • Några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom utveckling av Data Analytics och BI-lösningar.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋

Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.

Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.

Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant)
Description:
Come work with us

Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.




What does it mean to be a Data Engineer Consultant at Netlight?

It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar with your experience, and from there it is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like. As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems, and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.




As a Data Engineer Consultant, you will help our clients in projects with roles in Data Engineering. It can be working within Data Engineering, Data Architecture, or project management in terms of working with data or utilizing data to make product decisions to mention a few examples.




Minimum Qualifications

Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
Verbal and written fluency in English
0,5-5 years of work experience within the data engineering field related to IT and software products in agile teams




Application

We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

Title: Dataanalytiker
Description:
Vi söker nu efter en Dataanalytiker till vår kund inom offentlig sektor.




Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

Ingå som en del i teamet för området Trafikinformation/Indatakvalitet.
Analysera data för trafikinformation och fordonsinformation genom inhämtning av data från bland annat Data lake och Data warehouse i Azure och AWS
Skapa rapporter och dashboards i PowerBI
Ta fram och presentera dataunderlag, analyser och insikter
Ta fram förbättringsåtgärder för att öka indatakvaliteten
Säkerställa/verifiera korrekthet av vår information relaterat till Trafikinformation, genom beräkningar och statistiska modeller med Python, SQL, m.m.
Delta i prioriteringen av aktiviteter inom området.
Mer information om uppdraget förmedlas om man går vidare i urvalet.




Obligatoriska krav:

Högskoleingenjör, dataanalytiker, systemvetare eller motsvarande utbildning inom datavetenskap/maskininlärning/matematik/statistik.
Minst fem (5) års arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som dataanalytiker, riktat mot felsökning och kvalitetskontroll utifrån krav och gällande integrationskontrakt.
Minst tre (3) års arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling i Python.
Minst tre (3) års arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med dataanalys inom AWS och/ eller Azure. Arbete ska inkludera utvärdering av färdiga analysrapporter till att vidareutveckla analysmodeller inom AWS eller Azure.
Konsulten ska ha minst tre (3) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att självständigt skriva och använda SQL-frågor för datauttag, analys eller systemintegration i sitt dagliga arbete.
Minst fyra (4) års arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla rapporter och datavisualiseringar med PowerBI eller liknande BI verktyg i det dagliga arbetet.
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift.




Placeringsort: Stockholm

Omfattning: Heltid på plats i kundens lokaler med möjlighet till distansarbete.

Start: 2025-06-02, väldigt långsiktigt uppdrag.




Information:

Bakgrundskontroll utförs på kundens begäran.
Ansök senast 2025-05-14
Urval av kandidater sker löpande och annonsen kan tas bort tidigare.




Om Agiremus

Sedan 2015 har vi hjälpt flertalet medarbetare att komma ut på arbetsmarknaden samt att nå sina karriärmål runtom i Sverige. Genom att skapa och bibehålla meningsfulla relationer med våra samarbetspartners kan vi presentera en bred rad av arbetsmarknadens mest attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för våra medarbetare och kandidater. Agiremus verkar inom de flesta branscherna, både inom privat och offentlig sektor.




Vi erbjuder:

Agiremus erbjuder dig som konsult en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att utvecklas inom din roll. Vi bryr oss om dig som och strävar efter långsiktiga samarbeten. Som konsult hos oss ges du, förutom spännande uppdrag, möjlighet att dela din resa med andra konsulter. Med jämna mellanrum anordnar vi tillfällen för er att träffas genom olika aktiviteter. Självklart kommer du även att ha en engagerad kontaktperson hos oss som finns där som bollplank och stöd. Vi erbjuder dig även goda personalförmåner som:




Anställning med fast månadslön.
Semester enligt semesterlagen.
Tjänstepension.
Heltäckande sjukvård- och olycksfallsförsäkring dygnet runt, årets alla dagar.
Friskvårdsbidrag m.m.




Välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.




About the position: (This is a Maternity Cover role - FTC 11 months )

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsen’s panel members in Denmark. 

The Data Analyst / Panel supporter maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.







Responsibilities:
Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians
 Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency





Key Competencies:
University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits. 
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape. 
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members
Able to speak and communicate in English


Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications












Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Data Analyst (Marketing Insights)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are seeking a talented and driven Data Analyst or Senior Data Analyst to join us in shaping the future of our newly established Demand Analytics team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in enhancing our team's capabilities around Marketing analytics while benefiting from a robust support structure designed to foster growth and innovation.

As a Marketplace, Marketing is one of Too Good To Go’s most powerful levers for driving demand. Consequently, a strong foundation in marketing metrics is essential for this role. The models and methodologies you will help develop are largely marketing-focused, emphasizing the importance of experience with causal impact modeling and econometric modeling.

That said, Demand Analytics at Too Good To Go extends beyond Marketing. We are looking for someone who can also contribute to broader analytical initiatives, such as demand forecasting and other data-driven projects.

If you’re passionate about leveraging analytics to make a real-world impact and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.

This role can be baised either in Copenhagen or London (Shoreditch).

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Collaborate with marketing teams to optimize campaign strategies and resource allocation based on data-driven insights
Conduct in-depth analyses to identify the drivers of demand and measure marketing impact
Utilize marketing insights to inform and enhance demand forecasting models


Requirements


You have an understanding of Marketing Data and KPIs, or a strong appetite to learn this space.
Having experience in analyzing and interpreting marketing performance metrics would be a clear advantage.
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You have hands-on experience working closely with senior stakeholders, ideally within Marketing, to deliver data-driven insights.
You are skilled in designing, executing, and interpreting A/B tests, as well as applying causal inference and impact modeling techniques.
You have econometric modeling experience; familiarity with marketing mix models (MMM) is a plus.
You are proficient in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and transformation
You have Python expertise for data pre-processing, or statistical analysis. R would also be considered.
You are passionate about data literacy, continuously striving to improve your own skills and those of your team.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Our values

  • We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
  • We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
  • We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
  • We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
  • We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.

What We Have To Offer

  • An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
  • To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
  • Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
  • We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
  • To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
  • An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
  • We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
  • We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
  • We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.

How To Apply

  • We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above.
  • Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
  • Please submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
  • Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer/Data Analyst – Microsoft Fabric, Analytics and Insights, GN Group

Are you interested in a position within an analytics team, actively engaged in shaping the way our business interacts with data — from building the underlying dataflows to creating meaningful data products for insights that influence business decisions? This role is a hybrid of practical data engineering and insights generation, with a special focus on supporting the team's adoption of Microsoft Fabric and enhancing self-serve analytics capabilities.

In the role as Data Analyst you will contribute to our purpose of Bringing People Closer.

As our new Data Engineer, you will contribute to our purpose of Bringing People Closer. You will be working closely with the IT department, data analysts in your team and business experts. Your primary responsibility will be to deliver a robust data foundation that enables your colleagues to develop valuable insights for business stakeholders.

The team you will be part of

At our global HQ, located in Ballerup, Denmark, you will be part of the Analytics and Insights team within the Global Customer Experience (GCX) function. The team consists of five data analysts with skills in data engineering, modelling, insights development, process automations, advanced analytics and user adoption. We provide actionable insights within our own function, external GN departments and are closely collaborating with other BI teams across the organization.

This is a team where personal development is highly valued, collaboration is actively encouraged and supported, and new ideas are always listened to. We have adopted the new technologies and processes while organizing our work in a structured and governed way.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:


Coordinate the integration and adoption of Microsoft Fabric within the BI team.
Design and implement a lakehouse framework for the department.
Build robust, reusable pipelines and transformations in Fabric.
Support data governance, lineage, and workspace structures across business units.
Manage, evaluate, and validate data from various sources to ensure data quality and integrity.
Champion best practices around data modeling, naming conventions, semantic layer design.
Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements, ensure data flow improvements, and develop scalable and re-usable data products.
Manage and maintain the team’s Git repository.
Translate business requirements into data model designs and technical specs for BI backend developers.
Analyse data from a business perspective, create insights and produce reliable and actionable recommendations for GCX Management and key business stakeholders.
Manage data-centric initiatives within GCX and offer authoritative guidance on issues pertaining to data.


Your personal and professional journey is valuable to us, and we consider the following factors as possible contributors to a mutually beneficial partnership. You have:


Solid experience with data engineering tools (ETL/ELT pipelines, data transformations, data modelling).
In-depth experience with or a keen interest in Microsoft Fabric.
Proficiency in SQL, especially Python, and Spark for data transformations.
Solid working knowledge of Power BI, including DAX, Power Query, and dataset optimization.
Experience using Git for version control.
Thorough experience with designing and structuring data for efficient querying and analysis.
Effective communication skills, stakeholder management abilities and ability to collaborate across the organization.
Capacity for self-guided work and collaboration within a group setting.
A relevant higher education degree in IT, engineering, or other relevant fields of studies.
A genuine interest in data and a mindset of continuous learning and upskilling — whether it's exploring new tools, staying current on platform updates, or sharing knowledge with the team.


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset and motivation that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure progress for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 30 of April 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Manager of the Analytics and Insights team on +45 28 27 01 27 or Talent Attraction Partner at: aniewiadomy@gn.com

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our innovative intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Aalborg Municipality, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Data Analyst – Drive Operational & Strategic Impact in the Global Music Industry

Location: Aalborg, Denmark (Hybrid possible)

Company: Music Manager




Do you dream of working with big data, music, and real-world impact—every day?

At Music Manager, we work with some of the most prominent investment firms and label groups in the world to help them unlock the full commercial potential of their music rights. Our data-driven platforms power strategic decisions behind thousands of top digital assets globally.




We're now looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Aalborg and take a central role in our operational and technological evolution.




What you’ll do:

As our in-house Data Scientist, you'll help us turn complexity into clarity—both for our internal teams and our clients. You will:

Support end-to-end execution of client projects by bringing structure, insights, and clarity to large, messy, and complex data sets.
Source, structure, and manage critical datasets, working with everything from consumption to rights metadata across platforms and stakeholders.
Analyze and produce metadata at scale, optimizing commercial output for high-value digital music catalogs.
Explore innovative ways to monetize and enhance data, tapping into collection societies, platforms, and other industry stakeholders across the value chain.
Co-develop internal systems and tools that directly contribute to our company’s intellectual property.
Work closely with our CTO (Lisbon) on the next generation of our platform—building new features and capabilities on a path from ML to AI.
Report directly to the Founder & CEO (Aalborg), and collaborate with finance (Aalborg), client services (Copenhagen), and tech (Lisbon).

What you bring:

A background in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or similar.
Strong Python + SQL skills. Familiarity with libraries like Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn is a plus.
Experience working with large datasets and building custom data pipelines or models.
Bonus if you’ve worked with music, media, or rights/royalties data—but not required.
Curiosity and a systems mindset: you don’t just analyze—you improve, automate, and optimize.
You’re passionate about using data to fuel strategy, not just dashboards.

What we offer:

A rare chance to work at the intersection of music, finance, and data science.
Real ownership in developing systems and products used by the world’s leading music investors.
A close-knit, high-trust team with global collaboration (Aalborg, Copenhagen, Lisbon).
Hybrid work flexibility + a cozy HQ in central Aalborg.
Lots of autonomy. Even more impact.




Apply now, or reach out directly via LinkedIn—we’re hiring with heart, and we’d love to hear from you.




Company Description

Music Manager is a technology-driven company specializing in maximizing the commercial potential of music rights portfolios. Partnering with labels, investment firms, and rights holders worldwide, we deliver tailored solutions through music catalog auditing and portfolio management, using cutting-edge technologies for measurable results.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For a newly created position, we are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to ensure continuous improvement, development, and timely delivery of regulatory reporting.




Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark is a leading player in the automotive financial services industry, operating as a joint venture between Semler Gruppen and Volkswagen Financial Services. To enhance reporting structures and meet evolving European standards, Moment Search & Selection is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join the IT-PMO team in Brøndby and to take on a key role in a newly created position.




Drive Data Excellence while bridging Business and Data.

With increased regulatory demands from the European Central Bank and the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA), you will play a crucial role in ensuring compliance, optimizing data processes, and driving continuous improvement in regulatory reporting. You will join a dynamic and forward-thinking environment where innovation, collaboration, and adaptability are key drivers of success. At Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark, you will be part of an international and growth-oriented organization that values your analytical thinking, proactive problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration.




In this role, you will be the link between business and data, ensuring that regulatory demands are translated into effective, data-driven solutions. You will work closely with skilled colleagues in IT, Finance, and Risk to develop high-quality reporting solutions and your key responsibilities will include:




Define, analyze, and refine regulatory reporting requirements from business owners and stakeholders.
Collaborate with business owners to produce detailed specifications and work with developers to translate these into SQL.
Represent business requirements, working closely with developers to ensure accurate implementation.
Participate in and facilitate testing with business stakeholders, ensuring all requirements are met.
Work effectively within agile teams, contributing to sprints and iterative development processes.
Develop and specify requirements for reports and data warehouses to support a variety of business needs beyond regulatory reporting.
Navigate and contribute to a complex international environment, ensuring compliance with global standards and best practices.




In this role, you will also need to build and maintain close working relationships with stakeholders at various levels. You will demonstrate strong analytical skills to ensure data integrity and quality in complex environments.




Your qualifications

To succeed in this role, you must have significant experience with complex data transformations and regulatory reporting. You should have a deep understanding of managing large datasets and collaborating across departments, and you must be able to communicate confidently in English, both verbally and in writing.




You hold a bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, finance, or in a related field and have at least five years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the financial sector. A strong proficiency in SQL and data warehousing is essential, and experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Qlik will be an advantage. Experience with data governance and GDPR compliance is essential.




You have developed a robust technical expertise that enables you to ask critical questions and provide guidance when needed. Additionally, you will act as a "safety net" for data handling, ensuring that data is managed accurately and in full compliance with relevant regulations and standards, both within Danish and German law.




Join an international workplace with significant opportunities for professional and personal growth.




At Moment Search & Selection, we are handling the recruitment of Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark’s new Data Analyst. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t hesitate to apply if this sounds like your next challenge! Once the right candidate is found, the recruitment process will be closed.




If you have any questions regarding the position, feel free to contact Senior Recruitment Consultant, Morten Thomsen, on mobile +45 31365625.




About Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark

Volkswagen Semler Finans Danmark A/S is a leading player in the automotive financial services industry, operating as a joint venture between Semler Gruppen and Volkswagen Financial Services. Semler Gruppen, with over 100 years of experience, is Denmark’s largest car importer, representing renowned brands such as Volkswagen, Audi, Skoda, Porsche, and Volkswagen Commercial Vehicles. Volkswagen Financial Services, a division of the Volkswagen Group, operates across 48 markets globally, making it the world’s largest provider of financial products and services to the automotive sector. Together, the two partners offer comprehensive and flexible financial, leasing, insurance, and mobility services to customers and dealers in Denmark.

Title: Student Data Scientist / Data analyst – Join a Fast-Growing Scale-Up!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Student Data Scientist – Join a Fast-Growing Scale-Up!

Are you passionate about uncovering business opportunities through data? Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company where your skills will make a real impact? If so, we have the perfect student job for you!

Legal Desk: Innovation, Growth & A Great Place to Work

At Legal Desk, we are transforming the legal industry through automation, making legal services more accessible and affordable for individuals and businesses across the Nordics.

As Denmark’s leading provider of automated legal services, we help form over 30% of all new Limited liability companies in Denmark and are expanding into Sweden and Norway. With 275,000+ users, our growth is accelerating - and we want you to be part of the journey!

At Legal Desk, we believe that innovation, creativity, and ownership fuel success. As a Student Data Scientist, you’ll gain hands-on experience in a dynamic, supportive, and fast-moving environment, all while having the flexibility to balance work with your studies.

If you're ready to apply your skills to real-world challenges and grow in a company that values your development, then let’s talk! 🚀

Shape the Future of Data at Legal Desk

As our Student Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in transforming our data into powerful insights that drive smarter decision-making. Your work will involve integrating diverse data sources (GA4, Virk open data, internal databases, etc.) into dynamic dashboards, helping uncover key insights, solve business challenges, and improve our platform’s performance.

If you love working with data, thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, and want to make a real impact, we want to hear from you!

What You’ll Do


Identify business challenges and opportunities and translate them into meaningful visualizations.
Analyze data to optimize business operations and improve the customer experience. Build data models and visualizations, primarily for dashboards.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders in marketing and UX to collect, process, and integrate data from multiple sources.


Who You Are


Currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Data Science or a related field
A strategic thinker with a business-oriented mindset
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, startup environment
You live in Sweden or Denmark, and you are able to work from our physical office in Copenhagen. Work from home is optional from time to time, however we find it important that you are a part of the social culture in Legal Desk, why you must be able to work form the physical office.


Your Technical Skills

Must haves:


Python – Very proficient (3+ years, including academic experience)
Strong understanding of Python and database structures
Experience with key Python libraries: Pandas. Plotting libraries (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
SQL experienced + basic knowledge of data-base structures


Nice to have


Familiarity with Git (basic experience required)
Basic web scraping knowledge
Basic understanding of HTML & CSS
Basic knowledge of BI dashboard principles
Experience with Google Analytics (GA4) and Looker is a plus, but not required
Experience with Streamlit (Python module) is a plus, but not required


Why Join Us?

At Legal Desk, we offer a flexible work environment that adapts to your studies, allowing you to balance your education with real-world experience. You’ll work alongside a vibrant team of students, gaining hands-on experience in a supportive and innovative environment.

But it’s not just about work - you’ll also get to be part of our thriving social culture! From company trips to some of our many Friday bars, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to connect, collaborate, and have fun with your colleagues.

If you’re excited about using data to drive meaningful change - apply today! 🚀

Write a very brief motivational letter along with your CV.

DEADLINE: Monday 5th May 2025
Show more

Write a very brief motivational letter along with your CV.

DEADLINE: Monday 5th May 2025

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Data Analyst - Product
Description:
Are you passionate about turning data into game-changing product insights? Do you thrive in an environment where your analytical skills help shape the future of digital banking? 

At Lunar, we’re looking for a Data Analyst - Product to bring clarity to complexity, empowering our teams with the insights they need to build world-class products. If you love working with data, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and making a tangible impact, keep reading!

At Lunar, we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Stockholm 🚀

So, who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Data Analyst - Product to drive data-driven decision-making so that we can optimize our product strategy and deliver seamless customer experiences.

As our new Data Analyst - Product, you will be part of our Product team, reporting to Helena Buhr. The team currently comprises 3 amazing individuals working across Aarhus and Copenhagen, who are focused on embedding a data-centric approach within our Product function, led by Christina Vestergaard.




What will you do?

Conduct in-depth analysis to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights that shape product roadmaps and strategic decisions.

Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the impact of product initiatives.

Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytics tools to ensure visibility into key product metrics.

Collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and other teams to integrate data into decision-making.

Work with Data Engineering and Analytics Engineering teams to enhance our data ecosystem, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.

Deliver compelling data storytelling through visualization and presentations to influence stakeholders.


Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.


We’re excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Proven track record of delivering impactful analytics insights.

Strong strategic thinking with the ability to translate product and business objectives into analytical plans.

Advanced skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization.

Proficiency in SQL and experience with analytics tools like Looker. Experience with dbt, GitHub, and Python is a plus.

Understanding of product development processes and experience working in agile environments.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills to influence cross-functional teams.

Fluent in English, both written and verbal.


Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰

Depending on the regulations in the country where you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Ageras, we are redefining how entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking, and administrative tasks. Through seamless tools and innovative accounting & banking solutions, we help them focus on what matters most: growing their businesses.

Our vision is to become the best friend of every small entrepreneur across Europe. 💚

Over the years, Ageras has grown through the merging of top European FinTechs like Shine (🇫🇷), Kontist (🇩🇪), Tellow (🇳🇱), and more. Today, we’re a team of nearly 500 people, including 150 talented engineers, working together from Paris, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Berlin.




👀 Data at Ageras

At Ageras, we're revolutionizing the way entrepreneurs—freelancers, self-employed professionals, and SMEs—manage their banking and administrative tasks. Operating in the ever-evolving FinTech space, we face one of the industry's most intricate challenges: building a robust, reliable architecture to enable seamless data collection, analysis, and visualization. Unsurprisingly, our Data team plays a pivotal role in driving Ageras' success!

Our Data department is organized into three specialized squads: Data Analytics, Data Modeling, and Data Platform, ensuring optimal efficiency and focus.

We are now seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our Data Analytics team, currently composed of 4 data analyst and 1 lead data analyst.

As for our tech stack, we work with Python, AWS, Snowflake, Big Query, Meltano, Terraform, Dagster, and dbt for data modeling. If you're passionate about leveraging these tools to shape the future of FinTech, we'd love to hear from you!

📋 Your Role as a Senior Data Analyst

Data analysis at Ageras means working with a large volume of data across diverse domains (payment transactions, user behavior and conversion, product usage, ticket volume, revenue, marketing...), and and draw business insights from it to support or impact the company strategy 💥




Your Responsibilities Will Include

Data Analysis & Visualization
Build and optimize analytical data models using dbt.
Develop and maintain dashboards on Looker Studio and Metabase to empower teams with actionable insights.
Analyze complex datasets to solve business challenges and provide recommendations.
Collaboration & Strategy
Work closely with Business, Tech, and Data teams to align on priorities and insights.
Translate stakeholder needs into effective data solutions.
Deliver clear, data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making.
You will work closely with Product team on the product roadmap and help them on applying analysis like A/B test
Team Development & Best Practices
Help grow and structure the Data Analytics team by sharing knowledge and mentoring junior members.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis, visualization, and architecture.
Stay on top of emerging tools and methodologies to optimize our processes.




🔎 About you

You have 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst with advanced skills in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Tableau).
You have significant experience with modern data stacks (BigQuery, dbt) and a strong focus on detail and precision.
You simplify complex findings into clear, actionable insights for diverse stakeholders and decision-makers.
You demonstrate adaptability and proactivity, enabling you to thrive in dynamic and challenging work environments.
Teamwork is key for you: you enjoy mentoring others while continuing to grow and learn.
You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.




🎉 Our Perks

Remote Work Culture: Located in Paris with possibility of two remote working days per week but also you can you can work in all Ageras offices: Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Poland
Office Perks: Complimentary tea, coffee, refreshments, fruits, and snacks available daily.
Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.
Team Building and Events: Participate in biannual team-building activities and summer/winter corporate events.




💚 Our recruitment process

1️⃣ A 45’ introductory call with Annaïg (Talent Acquisition Specialist) to learn more about each other and give you an overview of Ageras.

2️⃣ A 90’ interview with Saghar (Lead Data Analyst) to discuss your experience, dive into the role, and evaluate your SQL skills.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

  • You are fluent in English and excited to work in an international team.

  • Career Growth Opportunities: Build a successful career with ample opportunities for professional growth within the firm.

3️⃣ A 30' business case presentation, where you’ll showcase your technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

Title: Business Intelligence, Internship, Lystrup
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in an international high-tech company that operates within specialized areas like aerospace, defence, security, and space? Our Business Intelligence Team within the Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department offers a unique opportunity for a passionate student who wants to be part of our internal talent pipeline.

We are facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. Therefore, we are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Intern to become part of this journey and contribute to our overall purpose – securing people through advanced technology.

Your role in our team

We are currently facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes. We are looking for a highly motivated BI Intern to become part of this journey and to join our Finance Systems & Business Intelligence department in Lystrup, which has a variety of responsibilities.

We offer an exciting position where you can start building your dream career. We will focus on your professional and personal development, and you will have the opportunity to make your mark in a dynamic company. You will experience a variety of tasks and the opportunity to apply your theoretical skills in practice. We pride ourselves on maintaining an open working environment where we support each other to stay focused, committed, and motivated to deliver value to our colleagues throughout Terma.

As a BI Intern at Terma, you will be part of a company with many engaged and knowledgeable employees, where technology, innovation, strategy, and continuous improvements drive everything we do. You will work closely with skilled colleagues and on exciting projects.

How you will make a meaningful contribution

Your Key Responsibilities Include


Assist in the development and maintenance of BI reports and dashboards
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in our BI solutions
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our BI processes
Participate in data analysis and visualization projects
Support the team in ad-hoc data requests and troubleshooting


Bring your world class expertise into play

You are fluent in English both in writing and verbal at a professional level. Danish is an advantage but not a requirement


We are looking for an Intern studying at the Bachelor’s or Master’s level within Business Intelligence, Data Science, Finance, or a similar field of study
Familiarity with BI tools such as MS Power BI, SQL, or DAX is a plus


As a person, you bring a positive, can-do attitude and you thrive on turning theory into action. You are self-driven, detail-oriented, and not afraid to juggle multiple tasks at once. Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you take pride in delivering high-quality work on time.

The key points to success in our team are to show commitment, work with passion both in groups and independently, have an outgoing and proactive personality, curiosity, and show initiative in the daily work. You solve your tasks within set deadlines and with a strong focus on quality and detail, of course in close cooperation with your colleagues. You work in a structured manner, make things happen, and identify and deal with issues proactively. You are a good communicator and understand the importance of cross-functional cooperation.

We are an international company representing world class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. You will also experience that we have a strong focus on your development, teaching you useful new competences and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment.

When joining Terma, we promise that you will experience: Great people, challenging tasks, world-class expertise, and meaningful contribution in your daily work.

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

If you would like to take on the challenge of working in an innovative company, we look forward to receiving your application. A resume is required, while a cover letter is optional. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

Do you have any questions regarding the position?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: osp@terma.com

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Bear in mind that both candidates and the candidate’s adult household members, for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails among other issues:


Full household as a minimum have stayed within NATO/EU countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad, and
None of the full household have committed serious criminal offences.


Terma group has headquarters in Denmark and is a high-tech company developing products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation.

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
Show more

  • Full household as a minimum have stayed within NATO/EU countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad, and
  • None of the full household have committed serious criminal offences.

Terma group has headquarters in Denmark and is a high-tech company developing products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation.

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Analytics Specialist
Description:
📍Sthlm/Gbg/Cph/Ldn/Italy

📆 As soon as possible

👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week

📚 Our Recruitment Process




At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.




Are you curious to learn more about us? You can meet some of our coworkers and read about our departments here. For insights into how is life at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.




We’re looking for an Analytics Specialist to join our team at Precis, working with clients in finance and healthcare - industries that offer exciting and complex analytics challenges.

At Precis, we transform data into value, ensuring our clients have the insights they need for growth while prioritizing user privacy and ethical solutions. You’ll work directly with clients, solve analytics challenges, implement technical solutions, and contribute to commercial processes - all with a focus on data governance and compliance.




What You Will Be Doing

Tagging and analytics implementations.
Leading complex collaborations and driving your clients’ analytics roadmap.
Exploring new ways to support clients in regulated industries and drive value out of compliant data.
Delivering actionable insights and supporting your clients’ profitability with data and analytics strategy.
Building dashboards and reports.
Ensuring the best data quality for clients and recommending improvements.
Continuously learning and mastering the latest technologies and techniques in our industry.




What We Are Looking For

2+ years of work experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
An understanding of data strategy and digital marketing.
Experience in data analysis and building insights out of extensive data sets.
An interest in privacy, data protection and data governance.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
Previous studies in topics related to data, tech, analytics or business.
A friendly personality with good collaboration skills, plenty of ambitions, and a desire to become a real expert in digital marketing.
[Preffered] Knowledge of SQL and programming languages such as Python or JavaScript.




What We Offer

You can read our full offering in our handbook.

An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
Transparent salary setting - you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L2 role within the Analytics column. Check it out!
30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.




We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.




We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.

Title: Data Analyst - Product
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about turning data into game-changing product insights? Do you thrive in an environment where your analytical skills help shape the future of digital banking? At Lunar, we’re looking for a Data Analyst - Product to bring clarity to complexity, empowering our teams with the insights they need to build world-class products. If you love working with data, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and making a tangible impact, keep reading!




At Lunar, we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Stockholm 🚀




So, who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.




As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Data Analyst - Product to drive data-driven decision-making so that we can optimize our product strategy and deliver seamless customer experiences.




As our new Data Analyst - Product, you will be part of our Product team, reporting to Helena Buhr. The team currently comprises 3 amazing individuals working across Aarhus and Copenhagen, who are focused on embedding a data-centric approach within our Product function, led by Christina Vestergaard.




What will you do?

Conduct in-depth analysis to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights that shape product roadmaps and strategic decisions.
Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the impact of product initiatives.
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and analytics tools to ensure visibility into key product metrics.
Collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and other teams to integrate data into decision-making.
Work with Data Engineering and Analytics Engineering teams to enhance our data ecosystem, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.
Deliver compelling data storytelling through visualization and presentations to influence stakeholders.




Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.




We’re excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Proven track record of delivering impactful analytics insights.
Strong strategic thinking with the ability to translate product and business objectives into analytical plans.
Advanced skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and data visualization.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with analytics tools like Looker. Experience with dbt, GitHub, and Python is a plus.
Understanding of product development processes and experience working in agile environments.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to influence cross-functional teams.
Fluent in English, both written and verbal.




Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰




Depending on the regulations in the country where you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.
