Title: Product Analyst with Power BI skills
Place: Brøndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Product Analyst with Power BI skills 

Do you want a rare opportunity to make an extraordinaire impact as part of a great team? 

If you have a passion for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data – and you know how to leverage Power BI in this context – this role offers a unique career opportunity. As part of Milestone’s transformation, your expertise will be a key asset for future growth. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to shape how the company works with telemetry data, giving you significant influence and learning opportunities. And you’ll do it as part of a well-functioning, collaborative team where teamwork, knowledge sharing, and mutual support are part of everyday life. 

Turn data into clear and insightful PowerBI dashboards 

Your primary mission is to help business colleagues achieve better results by providing them with valuable data-driven insights. You’ll engage in dialogue with stakeholders across various business areas to understand their goals and needs. Using this knowledge, you’ll collaborate with the Power BI backend team to to request, refine, and test data in our cross-organizational data model. From there, you’ll transform data into compelling, easy-to-understand Power BI dashboards. At the same time, you’ll continuously contribute ideas for optimizing our overall setup. Your primary tasks will be to:  



Engaging with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives 
Building Power BI dashboards in collaboration with the backend team 


Acting as the data/Power BI lead in various business projects 


Developing an understanding of how usage data fits into the overall value chain 


Assisting project teams in setting up data-driven metrics and coaching them on data interpretation (e.g., through workshops) 


Contributing to the compilation of monthly and quarterly royalty reports 



Experience in Power BI for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data 

We are looking for you that thrive on handling tasks independently while at the same time knowing when to engage with your colleagues to create 1 + 1 = 3. We are also looking for your entrepreneurial spirit as you shall play a key role in building the future way of working for your workstream. As part of this, you must be curious on new trends, technologies and tools.  Additionally, it is important that you like dialogue and collaboration with many different people covering multiple professions and nationalities. Finally, you can tick of the below:  



Degree in data science or equivalent experience  


Experience with telemetry/usage/behaviour data, preferably in a software company  


Power BI frontend experience, especially in visualization and storytelling of data with the data user in mind 


Knowledgeable of DAX and star schema models / the Power BI platform  


Experience with Azure DevOps and user story processes 



Your new team 

Your new workplace will be Milestone’s headquarters in Brøndby, Copenhagen, where you’ll join a team of eight skilled colleagues in the Product Operations team where you will be part of the Product Analytics and Performance workstream. Our team brings together experts in product excellence, performance, telemetry, qualitative research, and outcome-driven product management. We work cross-functionally to enable product teams to make informed, customer-centered decisions and deliver real impact.  

Just as important. You can look forward to being part of a highly functional, professional, and socially engaging environment. Our team is diverse – we are eight people representing seven different nationalities. At Milestone, you’ll experience a positive and welcoming culture with frequent social activities, an on-site gym, private health insurance, and additional perks like free drinks, fruit, lunch, Friday bars, and more. Flexibility is also a natural part of life at Milestone. 

Contact and application 

Please apply at our website using the ”Apply” button.  

You will experience an inclusive and unbiased recruitment process where all employment decisions are based on qualifications rather than race, color, ethnicity, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and religion. We advise you not to attach a cover letter to your application but instead, we encourage you to write a few lines about why you are applying for the position in your resume/CV. Additionally we recommend you not to add a photo in your resume/CV. 

If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Christina Hampson, Head of Product Operations at +45 2552 9352. 

We are looking forward to receiving your application.  

At Milestone, your work goes beyond what the human eye can see. With our unique video technology software, you help people make wiser and more responsible decisions – in and beyond security. Whether you advance our software, inspire to new integrations, or elevate our customers, you are part of a growth company recognized by the industry. We have a unique people-first approach to everything we do, and it’s not just empty words. Being part of a fun, friendly, and flexible environment you’ll find, that working here almost feels like a home away from home. If you are curious to know more about who we are, we suggest you visit http://milestonesys.com/career

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Do you want to join one of the world’s fastest-growing energy trading companies and play a key role in building our new Macro Trading portfolio? Keep reading; we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our newly established Macro Trading team.







In Macro Trading, we combine macroeconomic insights and data analysis with market-specific knowledge of power, gas, and emissions to generate trading decisions. The macro portfolio is like a start-up with a high degree of autonomy and the opportunity to explore new ideas to innovate and rethink European Energy Trading, while having the backing of a larger and mature organization, increasing the probability of success.




As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be key in building our quantitative macroeconomic framework. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with traders, quants, and other analysts to develop quantifiable and actionable analysis.




Your journey as a Quantitative Analyst

We seek a highly analytical and detail-oriented Quantitative Analyst with a dedicated focus on macroeconomics and econometrics to support our energy trading activities. In this role, you will leverage macroeconomic data—such as interest rates, inflation, and growth - and advanced econometric techniques to create proprietary models that forecast market prices and support our trading strategies.




The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the global macroeconomic landscape and how it influences commodity prices, energy supply, and demand, paired with exceptional skills in econometric modeling and quantitative research.




We will ensure you are ready to take on your new role by giving you the best possible introduction to the team, our business, and our organization. You will be introduced to our macroeconomic framework, and any potential knowledge gaps will be addressed to maximize your success.




At InCommodities, we do not believe in bureaucracy, stringent processes, or micro-management. Instead, we grant you high autonomy, which we believe unlocks greater engagement and ensures that the best decisions are made – always by those closest to the job.'




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement econometric models that predict key macroeconomic variables
Incorporate macroeconomic factors to predict energy prices and supply-demand dynamics
Collaborate with traders and quants to translate macroeconomic data and econometric insights into actionable trading strategies.
Continuously monitor and refine models to reflect changes in the macroeconomic environment




Qualifications – we imagine that you:

Hold a master’s degree or PhD in Economics, Finance, or a similar field with a focus on econometrics
Have experience with time-series analysis, forecasting, and other advanced econometric techniques
Possess excellent coding skills (Python is an advantage)
Preferably have knowledge of energy markets (oil, natural gas, electricity)
Have great communication skills enabling you to present complex macroeconomic insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Personal skills – we expect that you:

Are super passionate and knowledgeable about econometrics
Actively follow and understand what is happening in the world of macroeconomics
Have a curious and competitive mindset
Can be direct with your colleagues in a constructive way
Can work independently with a strong drive towards achieving results
Are a team player who will do what is best for the team and InCommodities




What you can expect from us:

You will join a team of experienced colleagues and will have the opportunity to work closely together with quants, analysts, and traders to build a macro trading desk
We will provide you with opportunities to develop both professionally and personally
We will provide you with flexibility and autonomy to drive real impact
You will be part a unique company culture where we live up to our values: Honesty, Transparency, and Rethink and where you don't have to abide by a dress code or a strict hierarchy, so you won't be frustrated with too many rules, policies, or bureaucratic processes.




Practical details

Location: Aarhus N, Denmark

Full-time job




Application deadline: As soon as possible




If you have any questions, please contact:

Morten Kold, Head of Macro Trading

Mail: mkj@in-commodities.com

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy & Management (Private & Business Banking)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.

As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunar’s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.

What will you do?

Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.

Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.

Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.

Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.

Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.

Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).

Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).

Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.

Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.

Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.

Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.

Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Student Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Student Quantitative Analyst

At MFT Energy, we are at the forefront of energy trading, driving market efficiency, and facilitating the green transition. We are seeking a talented student quantitative analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team trading European power. Collaborate with experienced professionals, who are dedicated to excellence every day.

About The Role

As a Student Quantitative Analyst, you will play an instrumental role in our dynamic Intraday team. You will work alongside highly skilled quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, execution-algo developers, system developers, and traders.

You will be part of a team working on machine-learning models that automatically execute in the market meaning you will get direct feedback on performance. With time, we will bring you into various decision-making processes as we believe in responsibility being a key driver for your success.

Your Key Responsibilities


Acquire and maintain data from external sources.
Contribute to existing trade signal frameworks.
Maintain and develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge.


Your Qualifications And Personal Skills


Studying: Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar.
A proactive approach and general interest in algorithmic trading.
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, etc. is considered a plus.
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.
The ability to work independently and structure your workload.
A positive and competitive attitude but at the same time a valued team player.
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English.


Above all, we cherish passion and creativity. If you have made hobby projects, feel free to share them.

Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are more than 180 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Türkiye, Australia, New York City, and Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best—we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.

We Offer


A part-time student position with a high degree of influence and autonomy, requiring on-site presence at our Aarhus C office to foster close collaboration and learning
A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.


Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a CV, a short cover letter, and your grade transcript. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Deadline: As soon as possible.

Start date: Flexible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.
Show more

Title: Student Worker, IT Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Milestone, your work goes beyond what the human eye can see. With our unique video technology software, you help people make wiser and more responsible decisions – in and beyond security. Whether you advance our software, inspire to new integrations, or elevate our customers, you are part of a growth company recognized by the industry. We have a unique people-first approach to everything we do, and it’s not just empty words. Being part of a fun, friendly, and flexible environment you’ll find, that working here almost feels like a home away from home. If you are curious to know more about who we are, we suggest you visit http://milestonesys.com/career 

As an IT Data Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of supporting critical data-related tasks within our organization, particularly within the IT department. Working closely with your team members, you'll actively contribute to our organization's data-driven decision-making processes, leveraging insights gleaned from the data you manage.

Your primary focus will revolve around handling IT-related data, including costs associated with software, hardware, and other IT resources. Your role is pivotal in ensuring transparency and accuracy in this crucial area. You'll have the opportunity to expand your skill set and knowledge base on the job, with ample room for growth and development.  

Your responsibilities will include:

Creating and Updating Reports:


Assist in creating new reports to address specific needs, guided by stakeholders' requirements.
Collaborate closely with team members to gather and organize data, and contribute to report development through data loading, transformation, and visualization techniques. 
Support the updating of existing reports as needs evolve, ensuring accuracy and relevance.


Maintaining Data Integrity:


Assist in routine maintenance tasks to ensure data accuracy and consistency. 
Proactively identify and troubleshoot errors and communicate resolutions effectively to team members.


Supporting Other Tools and Platforms:


Provide assistance in creating PowerPoint presentations and Excel spreadsheets as needed.


Your Profile
You are currently studying a related field within IT, Data Science, Data Analytics or studying business with a flair for data analytics and insights. Furthermore, we hope you see yourself in most of below:


Comfortable using Power BI for data visualization and reporting. 
Familiarity with DAX, the coding language of Power BI, or exposure to SQL basics. 
Ability to recognize and perform common data preprocessing tasks, such as data cleaning and transformations. 
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, vital for collaborating with stakeholders across teams. 
Able to create intuitive and user-friendly reports to convey insights effectively. 
Capable of conducting thorough investigations into the root causes of errors or anomalies. 
High level of English skills, both verbal and written


Please note that the position is on-site at our headquarters in Brøndby, Denmark, and requires that you have a valid Danish work visa.

Welcome to Milestone Systems
At Milestone you will experience a positive and welcoming environment with a global and diverse culture. We are more than 50 different nationalities in the Danish office and English is the corporate language.

We have our own gym with all the equipment you need and additional benefits like fruit, breakfast, lunch, free soft drinks, Friday bars and more.

If you want to develop your professional competencies we offer individual development plans, where you and your manager agree on the right learning path for you.

As our office is 5 minutes cycling from the nearest train station, we have bicycles that you can use.

Contact & Application
Please apply at our website using the ”Apply” button.  

If you have any questions for the position, please contact Director, IT Operations and End User Services, Anne Mikkelsen amk@milestone.dk

We are reviewing resumes on a continuous basis and recommend that you apply as soon as possible.

You will experience an inclusive and unbiased recruitment process where all employment decisions are based on qualifications rather than race, color, ethnicity, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and religion. We advise you not to attach a cover letter to your application but instead, we encourage you to write a few lines about why you are applying for the position in your resume/CV. Additionally we recommend you not to add a photo in your resume/CV.  

We are looking forward to receiving your application.


Show more

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst – Power Markets




A leading commodities firm is looking for a skilled Quant Analyst to strengthen its Quant trading team within the European Power market.




What We’re Looking For:

Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills
In-depth understanding of the European Power market
Strong Python programming skills (experience with SQL or other languages is a plus)
Proven ability to work effectively across cross-functional teams
A flexible mindset with a passion for tackling new challenges and solving complex problems
Demonstrated experience in writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and enhance quantitative models and analytical tools
Collaborate closely with various teams, including Trading, Middle Office, Risk, Credit, and Technology




Your Background:

Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Finance, or a related field
At least 2 and a half years of experience in the Power sector




Collaboration:

You’ll work directly with teams across the business - Trading, Risk, Credit, Middle Office, and IT

Title: Quantitative analyst
Description:
Are you skilled in valuation, Python & SQL? Eager to learn power markets & take responsibility? Join us as a Quantitative Analyst in a leading tech-driven energy trading company.

Here’s what the job entails
In the role, your primary function will be to analyse the European power markets and specific contracts linked to renewable assets. You will be compiling and analysing available data to build a solid foundation for our investment decisions. In addition, you will gain valuable experience of the European energy market and its price dynamics

Concretely, your responsibilities will include:

collaborating with portfolio managers, traders and analysts to perform valuation of financial products linked to energy generation
designing valuation frameworks and automating processes
maintaining and improving existing valuation and hedging tools
undertaking ad-hoc analysis tasks
proactively seeking to consolidate repetitive workflows and tasks



Meet the team
The power market analysis team supports the trading teams with thorough analysis, providing a solid foundation for investment decisions. Our primary area of responsibility is modelling the long-term evolution of the power market and prices within the European price zones.

We are a team of 10 specialists with backgrounds in engineering, physics and economics. We are a curious and innovative team, always seeking the information hidden in the data. We perform analysis with high integrity communicate the results to our stakeholders in a way that is easy to understand. We have an informal and humorous culture, where open communication and mutual respect are highly valued.

But enough about us… over to you!
As you will be working with a variety of stakeholders, we imagine that you are a great collaborator and are motivated to succeed as part of a team. We are also looking for someone who is able to work with complex tasks and can find efficient solutions while maintaining high standards of accuracy and integrity.

We also imagine that you:

hold a relevant educational background in engineering, physics, mathematics or economics
have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar position where you have built things
are experienced in coding in Python and SQL
are proficient in English - both written and spoken
are great at stakeholder management



We’ll take good care of you
At Danske Commodities, we take great care of our people. Joining us means you’ll get a lot of great perks – including social events, cultural experiences, tasty food and benefits to better your health, your life and your future.

Here are some of the benefits we offer our employees:

Flexible working hours including the option to work from home up to two days per week

Fuel Fridays a monthly Friday off with pay, except for July and December, to fuel your energy

Vast development opportunities with the help of your own individual development plan, access to our DC University with 50+ courses as well as remote courses through Harvard Learning

Global career prospects as part of the Equinor group with +20,000 colleagues across the world

10% paid pension as well as a beneficial health care and insurance package

Great parental leave conditions including 26 weeks of paid maternity leave, 16 weeks of paid paternity/co-parent leave, paid pension while on leave and the opportunity to join ‘Inspired Beyond Babies’

Unlimited paid children’s sick days no limit on paid absence days in relation to child sickness

Extra days off five to be exact, every year – adding to the standard five weeks off each year

Senior days if you’re over 55 years old

Compensation for working night and weekend shifts
Bonus scheme
Share savings meaning you have the opportunity to participate in our parent company Equinor’s attractive share savings programme

Paid at home internet and equipment including a mobile phone with paid subscription and IT equipment for when working from home

100+ yearly social and professional events including DC Sports and DC Talks events, gatherings in our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, CS:GO team and more

Various free tickets to family-friendly and cultural attractions

Discounts at hotels, restaurants, sports clubs and more

Organic food including a light breakfast, lunch buffet and snacks throughout the day

An office in the heart of Aarhus right next to the central train station

…. and much more

Recruitment process and relocation
You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What we’re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in +40 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers – the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But it’s actually our diversity of ideas we’re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleagues’ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.

In summer 2025, we'll be moving to our brand-new headquarters in Aarhus. Our future home, Akson, will be located in Sydhavnskvarteret – a vibrant district where business meets culture. On top of being in this urban oasis, we’ll enjoy state-of-the-art facilities – including our own barista coffee shop, modern fitness facilities and breathtaking views that will make every day at the office even sweeter. We can't wait.
Show more

You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What we’re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in +40 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers – the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But it’s actually our diversity of ideas we’re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleagues’ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.

In summer 2025, we'll be moving to our brand-new headquarters in Aarhus. Our future home, Akson, will be located in Sydhavnskvarteret – a vibrant district where business meets culture. On top of being in this urban oasis, we’ll enjoy state-of-the-art facilities – including our own barista coffee shop, modern fitness facilities and breathtaking views that will make every day at the office even sweeter. We can't wait.

Title: Student Analyst - Finland
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop your analytical skills? Are you studying data science or a business-related field? Do you want to work in a global, multicultural, and dynamic environment where you can link your academic knowledge to practical work?

In our Finnish Business Development team, we are currently looking for a Student Analysts with solid business understanding and experience in analyzing data sets.




Drive meaningful change

As a Student Analyst in the Finnish Business Development team, you will play an essential role in driving growth, developing operational procedures, and analyzing new potential products and market opportunities to grow our portfolios.

Your contribution will strengthen our ability to innovate, adapt, and make impactful decisions. You will experience a high degree of trust and responsibility in your job, making the work both challenging and rewarding.




Get a glimpse of our world

You will be part of a dynamic and ambitious team focused on professional development, individual responsibility, and team spirit. Our team currently consists of two student analysts and four full-time employees.

We believe that having varied perspectives drives innovation and growth. That’s why we’re open for different profiles and educational backgrounds to take our team’s impact to the next level.

Working at Abacus Medicine means working shoulder to shoulder every day across the entire organization to become the leading parallel importer company in Europe. We are busy, but we make sure to have a fun working environment with many social activities. In addition, the students at Abacus are valued to a great extent and receive a lot of responsibility. This is led by the existence of our student board, which has a strong influence when it comes to student culture and the future development of our students.




Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

In close cooperation with our Project & Portfolio Manager, you will be responsible for driving and expanding the Finnish product portfolio within both hospital and pharmaceutical sectors.

Your tasks and responsibilities will include:

Analysis of new potential products.
Analysis of new market opportunities.
Optimizing internal procedures.
Supporting the team with various daily ad hoc tasks.




Fuel for your success in the role

We expect you to be self-driven and to have the maturity to take ownership and handle challenges with a can-do attitude. Thriving in a dynamic culture, bringing an out-of-the-box mindset, and having a structured approach to complex problems are key to succeeding in these roles. The ideal candidate has experience of performing financial/economic analysis either from a company function or through their studies, furthermore we imagine that you:

Are currently enrolled on a degree program with focus on business or data.
Have professional oral and written skills in English. Knowledge of Finnish is considered an advantage.
Maintain excellent Microsoft Office skills, especially in Microsoft Excel. Proficiency in any statistical software is considered an advantage.
Have a business understanding and willingness to learn.
Have a natural interest in business development and international trade.




Would you like to know more about us?

If you are ready to take on this exciting opportunity, please submit your CV and a motivational letter.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Jennica Nieminen, Project & Portfolio Manager, at jennica.nieminen@abacusmedicine.com.

Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.




Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Show more

Title: Data/BI Specialist (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde ein Teil der HHLA und bewege mit uns die Zukunft!

Du liebst es, Daten in wertvolle Erkenntnisse zu verwandeln und möchtest die Zukunft unseres Unternehmens mitgestalten? Als Data/BI Specialist bist Du unser*e Experte*in für Datenanalyse und -management, unterstützt die Unternehmensbereiche und Key User bei datengetriebenen Entscheidungen und entwickelst innovative Lösungen. Werde Teil des BI-Teams der HHLA und bringe Deine Leidenschaft für Daten in spannende Projekte ein!

Die Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG (HHLA) ist ein führender europäischer Hafen- und Transportlogistikkonzern. Wir entwickeln mit unseren Kunden logistische und digitale Knotenpunkte entlang der Transportströme der Zukunft. Dabei setzen wir auf innovative Technologien und nachhaltige Lösungen. Der Konzern beschäftigt derzeit rund 6.700 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter.

Das erwartet Dich


Du entwickelst die analytische Datenarchitektur weiter, um die datengesteuerte Entscheidungsunterstützung im HHLA-Konzern zu fördern.
Du sorgst für eine konsistente und qualitätsgesicherte Datenbasis, indem Du strukturierte, semi- und unstrukturierte Daten integrierst, verarbeitest und transformierst.
Du analysierst die Daten und sagst zukünftige Entwicklungen und Ereignisse voraus, indem Du Methoden des maschinellen Lernens und andere Techniken der künstlichen Intelligenz einsetzt.
Du bereitest die Daten auf und präsentierst sie in Form von Berichten, Dashboards und anderen geeigneten Präsentationsformaten.
Du verantwortest die Betreuung der bestehenden BI-Landschaft.


Das bringst Du mit


Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse in ETL-Prozessen und kannst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen in das Data Warehouse (SAP BW und Oracle) und den Data Lake integrieren.
Du bringst praktische Erfahrung mit Big Data-Technologien wie Hadoop, Spark und Kafka zur Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen mit.
Du bist in der Lage, Datenmodelle zu entwerfen und zu implementieren, die den Anforderungen des Unternehmens und der Fachbereiche entsprechen.
Du besitzt starke analytische Fähigkeiten zur Interpretation von Daten und Gewinnung wertvoller Erkenntnisse.
Du hast Kenntnisse in relationalen, NoSQL- und Cloud-Datenbanken.
Du hast Erfahrung in Programmiersprachen wie (PL/)SQL, Python, R oder Java zur Automatisierung und Analyse von Datenverarbeitungsaufgaben.
Du kannst Daten in verständlichen und ansprechenden Formaten mit Hilfe von Crystal Reports, Analysis for Office und QlikSense präsentieren.
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und hast gute Englischkenntnisse.


Du hast Interesse, aber erfüllst nicht alle Anforderungen? Lass uns gern sprechen!

Das bieten wir Ihnen


Flexibles Arbeiten und eine gute Work-Life-Balance: 37 Wochenstunden in Vollzeit, mobiles Arbeiten und Gleitzeit
Eine transparente und attraktive Vergütung gemäß Tarifvertrag inklusive Weihnachtsgeld und variabler Vergütung
Gemeinsam in die Zukunft: Unbefristete Zusammenarbeit und eine attraktive Altersvorsorge durch unseren HHLA Kapitalplan
Weitere attraktive Benefits wie z.B. ein Zuschuss zum Deutschland Ticket, Corporate Benefits und Fahrrad Leasing über JobRad
Einen Arbeitsplatz mitten in der Hamburger Speicherstadt zwischen Hafencity und Innenstadt
Ein vielfältiges Angebot an internen und externen Weiterbildungen, Trainings und Workshops
In der Speicherstadt, auf den Terminals und über die Kaikante hinaus: Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der Kollegialität und Wertschätzung gelebt wird


Als international tätiges Logistikunternehmen mit Wurzeln in Hamburg steht die HHLA für Weltoffenheit und Toleranz. Wir sind überzeugt von den Vorteilen unterschiedlicher Perspektiven, Erfahrungen und Kompetenzen. Es ist unser Ziel, ein Arbeitsumfeld zu schaffen, in dem Menschlichkeit, gegenseitiger Respekt und Wertschätzung die Grundlage für das Handeln aller Mitarbeitenden sind.

Wenn Du gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft der HHLA gestalten möchtest, freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung – bevorzugt online über unser Bewerbungsformular.

Dein Kontakt

Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG

Bereich Personalmanagement

Nina Harbecke
Show more

Title: Data Engineer, Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer, Data & Analytics, Global IT

Are you passionate about data? Do you have experience in preparing data to facilitate innovative analytics solutions? Do you aspire to empower businesses to employ self-service analytics in a global organization focused on brain health? If that sounds like you, Lundbeck wants to hear from you!

Your new role

You will contribute to empower our business to leverage and gain value from our state-of-the-art data platform within an ambitious, dynamic & international team.

Collaborating with fellow data engineers, data professionals in our business units, and other stakeholders in cross-functional teams, you will contribute to creating and enabling impactful data products to our global lines of business in R&D, commercial, and manufacturing.

Working as a data engineer at Lundbeck, you will get a unique opportunity to leverage advanced technologies together with motivated colleagues in a company committed to restoring brain health.

Your future team

As our data engineer, you will join a team committed to bringing cutting-edge data platform technologies and bespoke data deliveries to the Lundbeck business based on best-practice data management principles.

We leverage dbt and Snowflake as the core of our data deliveries, using Python and SQL as our go-to languages for development. The rest of our stack is mainly focused on enabling efficient DataOps and we strive to build things right. Upon joining, we'll provide comprehensive onboarding to get you up to speed on our DevOps, and DataOps tools.

The Data & Platform team is part of our new Data & Analytics department in Global IT, a department currently consisting of approx. 25 data-, software-, and AI engineers. We are on a mission to provide innovative solutions to the whole of Lundbeck focusing on unlocking the value of our data.

What You Bring To The Team

Whether your greatest strength is in solving technical challenges or igniting enthusiasm in delivering quality products, your colleagues would agree that you are a role model in collaboration and co-creation, and that you are technically adept. You are passionate about leveraging technology to deliver best-in-class data models.

In addition, you have:


Minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
Extensive experience ingesting, preparing, modeling and orchestrating data in data engineering or similar role, for example in sales, manufacturing, or research domains.
Advanced ability to collaborate in cross-functional teams, effectively interpreting and translating user requirements into practical data solutions.
Experience with bridging the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders is beneficial.
Familiarity with developing BI products and dashboards is advantageous.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include your motivation for applying. No separate cover letter is needed. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions or want to hear more, please feel free to contact Kjetil Lavik, Head of Data & Platform at kjla@lundbeck.com.

Applications must be received by 4th of May, but don’t wait to apply as we will be having interviews ongoingly.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

#EveryBrainInTheGame

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: Performance Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a knack for uncovering game-changing insights from complex data? Can you transform numbers into compelling stories that drive customer behavior for global brands? If so, seize this opportunity to make a significant impact as a Performance Intelligence Consultant at VML MAP!

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include


Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
Prepare and present performance reports and translate the insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
Design, execute and analyze A/B tests to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
Approach all task with curiosity and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data.


Who are you going to work with?

You'll join our growing Insights and Intelligence team, reporting to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with various teams, especially data and analytics specialists, and be the bridge between client and technical teams.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have


A strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates and journey data and experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels.
Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau. Knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools.


A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click "Apply now" below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.


Show more

What will your day look like?

As Performance Intelligence Consultant, you'll be at the forefront of data-driven decision-making and play a vital role in understanding client priorities and objectives. With a foundational understanding of user experience and a strong grasp of data and analytical approaches, you'll be the bridge between data and strategy. Your daily activities will include conducting detailed data analysis to identify performance trends, designing and executing A/B tests and analyzing the results to provide optimization recommendations. You'll also be preparing and presenting performance reports, and your strong communication skills and storytelling abilities will ensure that actionable insights are delivered in an easily understood format, and in a way that motivates and provides a clear direction for various teams.

More Specifically, Your Tasks Include

  • Conduct detailed data analysis to identify performance trends and insights.
  • Prepare and present performance reports and translate the insights to internal teams as well as our clients, with a focus on content, audience, and channels.
  • Maintain and update performance dashboards and analytics tools.
  • Collaborate with various teams to ensure data-driven decision-making.
  • Design, execute and analyze A/B tests to identify the most effective strategies and tactics.
  • Approach all task with curiosity and open-mindedness, constantly striving to uncover further insights from the available data.

Who are you going to work with?

You'll join our growing Insights and Intelligence team, reporting to the Performance Intelligence Lead. You'll work closely with various teams, especially data and analytics specialists, and be the bridge between client and technical teams.

What do you bring to the table?

We're looking for curious minds with a strategic outlook and a passion for data. You're not just comfortable with numbers; you're adept at translating them into narratives that resonate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and you have a strong curiosity to discover the 'why' behind the data. Additionally, you are very collaboratively oriented, and you love working with cross-functional teams. Your expertise in detailed analysis and optimization will be instrumental in driving improvements and delivering actionable insights that enhance our daily tasks for clients.

In Addition, You Have

  • A strong understanding of marketing performance metrics such as open-rates, click through rates and journey data and experience analyzing campaign performance across digital channels.
  • Experience with data visualizations tools such as Power BI and Tableau. Knowledge of SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.
  • Ability to translate complex data into understandable insights for non-technical audiences.
  • Skills in crafting compelling narratives from data insights.
  • Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to clients and/or Senior stakeholders.
  • Skills in managing expectations and building trust with clients and internal teams.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment with an open mind.
  • Understanding of A/B testing methodologies and tools.

A leader in personalized customer experiences

VML MAP is a world-leading Centre of Excellence that helps businesses humanize the relationship between the brand and the customer through hyper personalization at scale, marketing automation and CRM. With the brain of a consultancy, the heart of an agency and the power of technology and data, we work with some of the world's most admired brands to help them on their transformation journey to becoming truly customer-centric. Together, we are 1000 + technology specialists, data scientists, strategic thinkers, consultants, operations experts, and creative minds from 55+ nationalities.

A global network

We are part of the global VML network that encompasses more than 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 60+ markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

WPP (VML MAP) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML MAP on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn and X.

When you click "Apply now" below, your information is sent to VML MAP. To learn more about how we process your personal data during when you apply for a role with us, on how you can update your information or have the information removed please read our Privacy policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week

Title: Principal Statistician
Description:
Principal Statistician | Global CRO |Denmark| Home Based |

Award-winning global biometric CRO have multiple opportunities for experienced Principal Statisticians to join its growing team.

Partnering with top pharma, biotech, and medical device companies, they deliver high-quality biostatistics, programming, data management, and data science services. Principal Statisticians can either be a hands-on technical role or more focused on being a Lead Statistician and is a great opportunity to grow with a recognized CRO, gain pharma experience, and benefit from continuous learning and development.

What you will be doing:

You will be working as a statistician on clinical trials; producing and validating complex outputs to excellent quality whilst adhering to deliverable timelines.

being responsible for statistical aspects of reporting out study results. Working as a lead statistician across multiple studies, with the opportunity to oversee more junior leads and supporting regulatory interaction Cardiology experience is a plus.

What you will need:

Educated to PhD or MSc in Biostatistics, statistics or a related discipline
Experience within the pharmaceutical industry to have a good awareness of clinical trial issues, design, and implementation.
Familiarity with GCP and regulatory requirements
Experience of writing SAPs, protocols

What’s in it for you:

Recognized as an outstanding workplace, committed to employee engagement, satisfaction, and work-life balance.
Structured training, development plans, and a supportive, friendly environment.
Condensed hours for a shorter workweek.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Fully remote role available in Denmark.

What to do next:

If this opportunity is of interest, please apply now with your CV as the organisation are looking to welcome Principal Statisticians onboard as soon as possible.

Not what you’re looking for?

Please contact Mark O'Brien at mark@warmanobrien.com for a confidential discussion about potential other opportunities in Denmark and across Europe.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer - Copenhagen:




Time to step up and leverage your data experience on a new journey!




We're looking for a Data Engineer to take charge of big data management and Azure infrastructure, ensuring seamless data flow, optimization, and reliability.

You'll be leveraging cutting-edge tools like Databricks and Snowflake to design, implement, and optimize robust data pipelines that power critical business insights.




You will be joining a dynamic team that drives a project team mentality - no solo players here!




Guiding, advising and driving new data-driven decision making all while becoming a core part of the team culture.




If you thrive in high-volume data environments and love working with the latest cloud technologies, this role is for you!




What you will bring:




Bachelors and/or Masters in an IT or Engineering related subject
Proficiency in Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Blob Storage for data integration, processing, storage, and analytics in the cloud
Experience in developing and deploying ETL solutions using SSIS to extract, transform, and load data from disparate sources into SQL Server databases.
Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools for version control, continuous integration, and automated deployment of data solutions.
Strong skills in data visualisation and reporting using Power BI
Proficiency in Python and SQL




Alongside the technology I need someone with a 'get stuff done' mindset.

This implementation is the next step in my client becoming a data driven business, as we any change things don't always follow the typical pathway.




Driving from the front to help maintain timelines and attention to detail.




This business really push for an inclusive working culture and hope everyone can feel welcome to our new data driven community.

There is a minimum requirement of 3 days a week in the office and fluency in Danish - written and verbal.




Want to know more?

d.nichol@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Advanced Analytics Lead
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Drive impactful operational outcomes through Advanced Analytics and become a key enabler of data-driven decision-making at LEGO. In this role, you'll support advanced analytics across the Operations and take a leading role within Manufacturing, integrating insights into strategic decisions. Join us as an Advanced Analytics Lead and shape the future of Operations!


Core Responsibilities





Develop and implement advanced analytics models, including predictive modelling, machine learning, and statistical analysis, to enable higher efficiency and productivity.
Analyse large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that drive business value using python/coding expertise in Databricks
Collaborate with project teams, data analyst, product teams and subject matter experts to identify data science opportunities and provide actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights to support strategic decision-making
Actively contribute to advanced analytics principles and best practices in collaboration with Data Office and BI Manufacturing and be an inspiration and sparring partner for colleagues.
You are a collaborative person by nature and want to be a part of a global cross functional team.
Curious and passionate about exploring and evaluating new methodologies and tools to enhance the organization's analytical capabilities




Play your part in our team succeeding

This role will be part of team Industry 4.0 and a new Data Engineering & Analytics team supporting Manufacturing in becoming even more data driven than today.

Industry 4.0 is part of Operation Transformation, which has the purpose of “stimulating” a shared E2E Innovation focus and by that enabling our Operation Aspirations. Operation Transformation functions as a network organization with teams of specialists interacting with relevant departments and functional areas within the LEGO organization as well as with external partners such as suppliers, universities, industry partners, technical institutes.

Do You Have What It Takes





Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL
Experience in DataBricks
Minimum a handful of years experience in data analysis, statistical modelling, and advanced analytics experience in Manufacturing.
Experience working as part of an autonomous team, managing personal goals, and contributing to team direction.
Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) and an understanding of MLOps practices, including DevOps principles like IaC and CI/CD pipelines.
It would be beneficial to have leadership experience as driving change is key part of the role
Ability to communicate complex analytical concepts to non-technical audiences
Already working in/with established network and forums and by that have easy access to knowledge and sparring.
Experience working in cross-functional teams and managing multiple projects simultaneously
Proficient in English, both written and verbal




The position is based in Billund, DK and relocation support is not offered for this role.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Title: Data/BI Specialist (m/w/d) More infos
Description:
Werde ein Teil der HHLA und bewege mit uns die Zukunft!

Du liebst es, Daten in wertvolle Erkenntnisse zu verwandeln und möchtest die Zukunft unseres Unternehmens mitgestalten? Als Data/BI Specialist bist Du unser*e Experte*in für Datenanalyse und -management, unterstützt die Unternehmensbereiche und Key User bei datengetriebenen Entscheidungen und entwickelst innovative Lösungen. Werde Teil des BI-Teams der HHLA und bringe Deine Leidenschaft für Daten in spannende Projekte ein!

Die Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG (HHLA) ist ein führender europäischer Hafen- und Transportlogistikkonzern. Wir entwickeln mit unseren Kunden logistische und digitale Knotenpunkte entlang der Transportströme der Zukunft. Dabei setzen wir auf innovative Technologien und nachhaltige Lösungen. Der Konzern beschäftigt derzeit rund 6.700 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter.

Das erwartet Dich


Du entwickelst die analytische Datenarchitektur weiter, um die datengesteuerte Entscheidungsunterstützung im HHLA-Konzern zu fördern.
Du sorgst für eine konsistente und qualitätsgesicherte Datenbasis, indem Du strukturierte, semi- und unstrukturierte Daten integrierst, verarbeitest und transformierst.
Du analysierst die Daten und sagst zukünftige Entwicklungen und Ereignisse voraus, indem Du Methoden des maschinellen Lernens und andere Techniken der künstlichen Intelligenz einsetzt.
Du bereitest die Daten auf und präsentierst sie in Form von Berichten, Dashboards und anderen geeigneten Präsentationsformaten.
Du verantwortest die Betreuung der bestehenden BI-Landschaft.


Das bringst Du mit


Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse in ETL-Prozessen und kannst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen in das Data Warehouse (SAP BW und Oracle) und den Data Lake integrieren.
Du bringst praktische Erfahrung mit Big Data-Technologien wie Hadoop, Spark und Kafka zur Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen mit.
Du bist in der Lage, Datenmodelle zu entwerfen und zu implementieren, die den Anforderungen des Unternehmens und der Fachbereiche entsprechen.
Du besitzt starke analytische Fähigkeiten zur Interpretation von Daten und Gewinnung wertvoller Erkenntnisse.
Du hast Kenntnisse in relationalen, NoSQL- und Cloud-Datenbanken.
Du hast Erfahrung in Programmiersprachen wie (PL/)SQL, Python, R oder Java zur Automatisierung und Analyse von Datenverarbeitungsaufgaben.
Du kannst Daten in verständlichen und ansprechenden Formaten mit Hilfe von Crystal Reports, Analysis for Office und QlikSense präsentieren.
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und hast gute Englischkenntnisse.


Du hast Interesse, aber erfüllst nicht alle Anforderungen? Lass uns gern sprechen!

Das bieten wir Ihnen


Flexibles Arbeiten und eine gute Work-Life-Balance: 37 Wochenstunden in Vollzeit, mobiles Arbeiten und Gleitzeit
Eine transparente und attraktive Vergütung gemäß Tarifvertrag inklusive Weihnachtsgeld und variabler Vergütung
Gemeinsam in die Zukunft: Unbefristete Zusammenarbeit und eine attraktive Altersvorsorge durch unseren HHLA Kapitalplan
Weitere attraktive Benefits wie z.B. ein Zuschuss zum Deutschland Ticket, Corporate Benefits und Fahrrad Leasing über JobRad
Einen Arbeitsplatz mitten in der Hamburger Speicherstadt zwischen Hafencity und Innenstadt
Ein vielfältiges Angebot an internen und externen Weiterbildungen, Trainings und Workshops
In der Speicherstadt, auf den Terminals und über die Kaikante hinaus: Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der Kollegialität und Wertschätzung gelebt wird


Als international tätiges Logistikunternehmen mit Wurzeln in Hamburg steht die HHLA für Weltoffenheit und Toleranz. Wir sind überzeugt von den Vorteilen unterschiedlicher Perspektiven, Erfahrungen und Kompetenzen. Es ist unser Ziel, ein Arbeitsumfeld zu schaffen, in dem Menschlichkeit, gegenseitiger Respekt und Wertschätzung die Grundlage für das Handeln aller Mitarbeitenden sind.

Wenn Du gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft der HHLA gestalten möchtest, freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung – bevorzugt online über unser Bewerbungsformular.

Dein Kontakt

Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG

Bereich Personalmanagement

Nina Harbecke
Show more

Werde Teil des BI-Teams der HHLA und bringe Deine Leidenschaft für Daten in spannende Projekte ein!

Die Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG (HHLA) ist ein führender europäischer Hafen- und Transportlogistikkonzern. Wir entwickeln mit unseren Kunden logistische und digitale Knotenpunkte entlang der Transportströme der Zukunft. Dabei setzen wir auf innovative Technologien und nachhaltige Lösungen. Der Konzern beschäftigt derzeit rund 6.700 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter.

Das erwartet Dich

  • Du entwickelst die analytische Datenarchitektur weiter, um die datengesteuerte Entscheidungsunterstützung im HHLA-Konzern zu fördern.
  • Du sorgst für eine konsistente und qualitätsgesicherte Datenbasis, indem Du strukturierte, semi- und unstrukturierte Daten integrierst, verarbeitest und transformierst.
  • Du analysierst die Daten und sagst zukünftige Entwicklungen und Ereignisse voraus, indem Du Methoden des maschinellen Lernens und andere Techniken der künstlichen Intelligenz einsetzt.
  • Du bereitest die Daten auf und präsentierst sie in Form von Berichten, Dashboards und anderen geeigneten Präsentationsformaten.
  • Du verantwortest die Betreuung der bestehenden BI-Landschaft.

Das bringst Du mit

  • Du hast fundierte Kenntnisse in ETL-Prozessen und kannst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen in das Data Warehouse (SAP BW und Oracle) und den Data Lake integrieren.
  • Du bringst praktische Erfahrung mit Big Data-Technologien wie Hadoop, Spark und Kafka zur Verarbeitung und Analyse großer Datenmengen mit.
  • Du bist in der Lage, Datenmodelle zu entwerfen und zu implementieren, die den Anforderungen des Unternehmens und der Fachbereiche entsprechen.
  • Du besitzt starke analytische Fähigkeiten zur Interpretation von Daten und Gewinnung wertvoller Erkenntnisse.
  • Du hast Kenntnisse in relationalen, NoSQL- und Cloud-Datenbanken.
  • Du hast Erfahrung in Programmiersprachen wie (PL/)SQL, Python, R oder Java zur Automatisierung und Analyse von Datenverarbeitungsaufgaben.
  • Du kannst Daten in verständlichen und ansprechenden Formaten mit Hilfe von Crystal Reports, Analysis for Office und QlikSense präsentieren.
  • Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und hast gute Englischkenntnisse.

Du hast Interesse, aber erfüllst nicht alle Anforderungen? Lass uns gern sprechen!

Das bieten wir Ihnen

  • Flexibles Arbeiten und eine gute Work-Life-Balance: 37 Wochenstunden in Vollzeit, mobiles Arbeiten und Gleitzeit
  • Eine transparente und attraktive Vergütung gemäß Tarifvertrag inklusive Weihnachtsgeld und variabler Vergütung
  • Gemeinsam in die Zukunft: Unbefristete Zusammenarbeit und eine attraktive Altersvorsorge durch unseren HHLA Kapitalplan
  • Weitere attraktive Benefits wie z.B. ein Zuschuss zum Deutschland Ticket, Corporate Benefits und Fahrrad Leasing über JobRad
  • Einen Arbeitsplatz mitten in der Hamburger Speicherstadt zwischen Hafencity und Innenstadt
  • Ein vielfältiges Angebot an internen und externen Weiterbildungen, Trainings und Workshops
  • In der Speicherstadt, auf den Terminals und über die Kaikante hinaus: Eine Unternehmenskultur, in der Kollegialität und Wertschätzung gelebt wird

Als international tätiges Logistikunternehmen mit Wurzeln in Hamburg steht die HHLA für Weltoffenheit und Toleranz. Wir sind überzeugt von den Vorteilen unterschiedlicher Perspektiven, Erfahrungen und Kompetenzen. Es ist unser Ziel, ein Arbeitsumfeld zu schaffen, in dem Menschlichkeit, gegenseitiger Respekt und Wertschätzung die Grundlage für das Handeln aller Mitarbeitenden sind.

Wenn Du gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft der HHLA gestalten möchtest, freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung – bevorzugt online über unser Bewerbungsformular.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Do you want to join one of the world’s fastest-growing energy trading companies and play a key role in building our new Macro Trading portfolio? Keep reading; we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our newly established Macro Trading team.







In Macro Trading, we combine macroeconomic insights and data analysis with market-specific knowledge of power, gas, and emissions to generate trading decisions. The macro portfolio is like a start-up with a high degree of autonomy and the opportunity to explore new ideas to innovate and rethink European Energy Trading, while having the backing of a larger and mature organization, increasing the probability of success.




As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be key in building our quantitative macroeconomic framework. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with traders, quants, and other analysts to develop quantifiable and actionable analysis.




Your journey as a Quantitative Analyst

We seek a highly analytical and detail-oriented Quantitative Analyst with a dedicated focus on macroeconomics and econometrics to support our energy trading activities. In this role, you will leverage macroeconomic data—such as interest rates, inflation, and growth - and advanced econometric techniques to create proprietary models that forecast market prices and support our trading strategies.




The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the global macroeconomic landscape and how it influences commodity prices, energy supply, and demand, paired with exceptional skills in econometric modeling and quantitative research.




We will ensure you are ready to take on your new role by giving you the best possible introduction to the team, our business, and our organization. You will be introduced to our macroeconomic framework, and any potential knowledge gaps will be addressed to maximize your success.




At InCommodities, we do not believe in bureaucracy, stringent processes, or micro-management. Instead, we grant you high autonomy, which we believe unlocks greater engagement and ensures that the best decisions are made – always by those closest to the job.'




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement econometric models that predict key macroeconomic variables
Incorporate macroeconomic factors to predict energy prices and supply-demand dynamics
Collaborate with traders and quants to translate macroeconomic data and econometric insights into actionable trading strategies.
Continuously monitor and refine models to reflect changes in the macroeconomic environment




Qualifications – we imagine that you:

Hold a master’s degree or PhD in Economics, Finance, or a similar field with a focus on econometrics
Have experience with time-series analysis, forecasting, and other advanced econometric techniques
Possess excellent coding skills (Python is an advantage)
Preferably have knowledge of energy markets (oil, natural gas, electricity)
Have great communication skills enabling you to present complex macroeconomic insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Personal skills – we expect that you:

Are super passionate and knowledgeable about econometrics
Actively follow and understand what is happening in the world of macroeconomics
Have a curious and competitive mindset
Can be direct with your colleagues in a constructive way
Can work independently with a strong drive towards achieving results
Are a team player who will do what is best for the team and InCommodities




What you can expect from us:

You will join a team of experienced colleagues and will have the opportunity to work closely together with quants, analysts, and traders to build a macro trading desk
We will provide you with opportunities to develop both professionally and personally
We will provide you with flexibility and autonomy to drive real impact
You will be part a unique company culture where we live up to our values: Honesty, Transparency, and Rethink and where you don't have to abide by a dress code or a strict hierarchy, so you won't be frustrated with too many rules, policies, or bureaucratic processes.




Practical details

Location: Aarhus N, Denmark

Full-time job




Application deadline: As soon as possible




If you have any questions, please contact:

Morten Kold, Head of Macro Trading

Mail: mkj@in-commodities.com
