Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking an experienced and strategic Business Analyst to lead business analysis efforts for a product. This role will involve collaborating with various stakeholders, managing a team of junior analysts, and driving data-driven decisions to support the organization's objectives. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, leadership qualities, and a deep understanding of business processes and technologies.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead and manage the business analysis team in gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements.
Collaborate with senior management and stakeholders to identify business needs and develop effective solutions.
Drive process improvements and operational efficiencies by analyzing current processes and recommending enhancements.
Develop and maintain comprehensive project documentation, including business requirements, functional specifications, and process flows.
Oversee the execution of user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure that solutions meet business needs.
Mentor and guide junior analysts, providing support and direction in their professional development.
Stay informed on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies that could impact the organization.
Present findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management.




Required Qualifications & Skills:

Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in business analysis or a related field, with a focus on mid-management responsibilities.
Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and manage a team.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a strong attention to detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and methodologies, as well as Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly.
Experience with project management methodologies and tools (e.g., Agile, Waterfall, JIRA, Confluence).




Preferred Qualifications:

Industry certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA) are a plus.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is an advantage.

Title: Cyber Response Services - Senior Analyst - KPMG Curve
Description:
Job details

Location: Leeds

Capability: Deal Advisory

Experience Level: Associate/Assistant Manager

Type: Full Time

Service Line: Technology & Data

Contract type: Permanent

Job Description

Cyber Response Services Senior Analyst – KPMG Curve

Base Location: Leeds based (Hybrid – 3 days per week in office)

As a result of the work that we do, we require applicants to hold or be capable of obtaining UK National Security Vetting, the requirements for which could include but not be limited to having resided in the UK for at least the past 5 years and being a UK national or dual UK national. Please note your application will not be taken forward if you cannot fulfil these requirements.

This is KPMG Curve, our newest tech venture. And we're doing things a little differently and we want You to come join us.

Here to solve big challenges and uncover even bigger opportunities, KPMG Curve is all about staying at the cutting edge of technology and swerving the mundane.

As a fast-growing digital delivery capability within KPMG, we always stay ahead of the curve by keeping up with ever-evolving tech practices. Whether that's unlocking the power of AI, coding for the future of the planet or everything in-between.

In a world where tech is always changing, so are we.

What’s in it for you?

Progression at pace. Innovation, led by constant learning. Work that excites you with every twist and turn. It all starts at KPMG Curve. Here, you’ll progress your career as part of a connected team, while being encouraged to be your true, authentic self.

At KPMG Curve, we offer career paths that can accelerate top performers, without having to go into management. You can stay technically-focused and carry on improving in your favourite tech field. You won’t be responsible for any sales work, either.

Other benefits include a learning allowance (so you can control your own growth) and paid overtime – prioritising the things that matter most to you. We take our work-life balance seriously, and will make sure you get time back if you’ve been working on anything heavy. At the end of the day, your well-being is what matters most.

What will you be doing?


Help manage and co-ordinate cyber security incidents for our clients, working closely with the incident management lead within the team.
Digital forensics of relevant incident data (disk, volatile memory, network packets, log files).
Maintaining a current view of the cyber threat and being able to advise clients on the threat landscape and attacks which may be relevant to them.
Develop KPMG’s in house cyber-response tools
Help assess client incident response capability maturity.
Help stand-up or improve clients’ own incident response capabilities.
Help with project management of engagements to deliver high quality work in a timely manner, including:
Scoping
Basic financial management
Engagement and risk management
Production and review of deliverables.
Liaising with clients on delivery, implementation and sales issues.


What will you need to do it?

As a result of the work that we do, we require applicants to hold or be capable of obtaining UK National Security Vetting, the requirements for which could include but not be limited to having resided in the UK for at least the past 5 years and being a UK national or dual UK national. Please note your application will not be taken forward if you cannot fulfil these requirements.


A broad understanding of the cyber security threat landscape.
Strong technical background in computers and networks, and programming skills.
Experience of dealing with cyber security incidents and associated response measures.
Experience of being part of an incident response team, either holding a formal role, or being able to evidence your personal contribution to the team.
Understanding of a wide range of information security and IT methodologies, principles, technologies and techniques.
A genuine interest and desire to work in the information security field.
Standing and positive reputation in the information security community is seen as a plus.



Skills we’d love to see/Amazing Extras:


Foreign language skills
Knowledge of incident and event management tools
Ability to use and also contribution to open-source technologies



To discuss this or wider Technology roles with our recruitment team, all you need to do is apply, create a profile, upload your CV and begin to make your mark with KPMG.

Our Locations:

This position will be based from our Leeds offices, with 3 days per week in the office

We can potentially facilitate flexible hours, and part-time options. If you have a need for flexibility, please register and discuss this with our team.

Find out more:

Within Tech and Data we have a range of divisions and specialisms. Click the links to find out more below:


Technology and Engineering at KPMG:
ITs Her Future Women in Tech programme:
KPMG Workability and Disability confidence:



For any additional support in applying, please click the links to find out more:


Applying to KPMG:
Tips for interview:
KPMG values:
KPMG Competencies:
KPMG Locations and FAQ:



Create next level tech. Impress us and surprise yourself. Do work that really makes a difference.

Swerve the mundane. Join KPMG Curve.

Why Deal Advisory at KPMG?

We partner with our clients to give them the confidence to make key decisions for their business. It's all about blending our deep sector expertise with our execution skills. Whilst we operate within a robust framework, we'll ensure you have the autonomy you need to shape the strategies behind our clients' decisions and help influence their successes.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Are you looking to take your Python coding & Agile software engineering skills to the next level, working on AI focussed software solutions?

Interested in joining an ambitious AI tech start-up (established) & learning from software industry veterans, who have over 20 years in the Software Engineering & Tech world?

If you are up for a challenging, yet very rewarding role at a company that provides an exceptional level of flexibility around technology & working practices, then we would like to hear from you!

With established clients, stable revenue streams & several in-demand AI apps', we are currently bucking the trend & have plenty of new feature development work.

You'll be joining an existing software engineering team of 10 (generally split into 2 Agile squads) & the hands on CTO, working on existing & new AI application development software.

Role: Python Software Engineer.

Location: Central Leeds, Yorkshire. We operate a 2 days per week in the office policy. Central Leeds city office. Nice, open plan shared office space in a tech hub type thing.

Salary: Up to £50K Basic (£40K - £50K basic depending on experience level; toward £50K basic would be more "senior" in the team) + Share incentive scheme + Training & development budget + Bonus Scheme.

We are looking for, roughly, 2 years (or more, of course), post-graduation, commercial experience in software development with a modern software language. Python preferred.

Our tech stack is mainly Python, Typescript (React.js) & Azure cloud services.

If all the above sounds good to you, please hit apply, or get in touch for a conversation.

I hope to hear from you soon!

Keywords: Python Developer, Python Software Engineer, Software developer, Software Engineer, Python, AI, ML, LLM, Leeds, Yorkshire, Tech start-up.

Title: Marketing Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Analyst

Location: LS11, Leeds, United Kingdom

Company: Smile White

Employment Type: Full-time




About Smile White:

At Smile White, we're redefining the dental care experience. Our brand stands at the intersection of innovative oral health solutions and premium cosmetic dentistry, offering a seamless journey from at-home teeth whitening to dentist-led care. We're rapidly growing and are looking for passionate individuals to join our mission to help everyone smile with confidence.




The Role:

We are seeking a data-driven and detail-oriented Marketing Analyst to join our dynamic marketing team. Based out of our LS11 office, the Marketing Analyst will play a key role in measuring campaign effectiveness, tracking customer behavior, and delivering insights that drive strategic decisions across all marketing channels.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse marketing campaign performance across channels (paid ads, social, email, influencer, SEO, etc.)
Monitor KPIs, prepare regular reports, and present findings to key stakeholders.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities using data from Google Analytics, Meta Ads, CRM systems, and other digital platforms.
Work with cross-functional teams to support product launches, promotions, and growth initiatives.
Develop and maintain dashboards to visualise marketing performance and ROI.
Conduct competitor analysis and market research to inform strategy.
Provide data-driven recommendations to improve customer acquisition, conversion, and retention.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Data Analytics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in a marketing analytics or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets, Google Analytics, and data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau).
Experience working with paid media data (e.g., Meta Ads, Google Ads) and eCommerce platforms.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Strong communication and presentation skills.




Desirable:

Experience in the beauty, healthcare, or wellness industry.
Familiarity with tools like HubSpot, Klaviyo, or similar CRM/Email platforms.
Understanding of A/B testing and customer segmentation strategies.




Why Join Smile White?

Be part of a fast-growing, mission-driven brand transforming smiles across the UK.
Collaborative and supportive team culture.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Staff discounts and wellness benefits.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Role: Senior Python Developer

Work Type & Location: 1 Day Per Week in Leeds

Role Type: Permanent, £55,000 to £70,000 (DOE)

Start Date: Immediately




We are working with a leading digital consultancy, supporting a range of innovative transformation projects across both public and private sectors. They are known for delivering modern, scalable user-centred digital services that have a real-world impact.




We are looking for highly skilled Senior Python Developers to join their multidisciplinary teams, passionate about building high-quality solutions with a user-first approach. You will bring strong technical expertise, a collaborative mindset, and the drive to deliver best-in-class digital services.




As a Senior Python Developer, you will:

• Act as a technical expert, designing, developing, and deploying modern cloud-native applications.

• Build and manage CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code for cloud deployments.

• Work with multidisciplinary teams including Product Managers, User Researchers, and Designers to build user-centric solutions.

• Present complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

• Support and mentor other developers to raise engineering standards across the team.




A successful Senior Python Developer will have:

• Expertise in Python development within cloud-native environments.

• Hands-on experience with AWS services (especially serverless technologies like Lambda, DynamoDB, EventBridge).

• Experience designing microservices architectures and RESTful APIs.

• Strong front-end development experience (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and ideally React or Node.js).

• Knowledge of containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes) and DevOps practices.

• Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code tools (CloudFormation, Terraform).

• Experience in agile delivery environments (Scrum, Kanban, TDD).

• Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels.




Senior Python Developer Key Benefits:

• Competitive salary package

• Guaranteed bonus (performance related)

• 6% employer pension contribution

• 25 days holiday plus public holidays




Not sure if you fit the bill for this role as a Senior Python Developer? Still, send your CV as we have various other roles available that may suit your skills.




Feel free to reach out to Adam Quigley at Anson McCade

Title: SharePoint Document Management Migration Engineer (FTC to Feb 2026)
Description:
Location: Leeds

Technology Directorate

The Technology Directorate provides information and system technology services to all business areas in the Bank as part of Central Services. Our key objective is to support the policy and operational divisions to meet the Bank's stated objectives.

The Technology Division structure is designed to reflect the delivery lifecycle for technology. New technologies and investments are planned and designed and then handed over to be built, maintained and run. All of this activity needs to be conducted in a way that ensures information and data is kept secure, for which a separate operating function has been created.

Job Description

This is a fixed term contract role for the remaining 25/26 financial year (ending February 2026). This role suits a knowledgeable M365 specialist to help industrialise the new approach to the Bank's document and records management system.

The Bank is migrating our document management solution from a legacy toolset to M365, primarily using SharePoint for document management. The Bank will also be using Microsoft Purview extended with a third-party solution Infotechtion i-ARM, hosted in Azure, to meet the Bank's records management requirements. We are currently in a pilot phase, and the successful candidates will be part of the delivery of the solution to the rest of the organisation.

This is an ideal opportunity if you are passionate about empowering people to be more productive and delivering a modern workplace experience at pace. This will be truly revolutionary for the Bank, and an opportunity to quickly leave a lasting legacy on a critical UK institution.

This role is open to flexible working patterns, which include:

Job share
Flexible start and end time to each day
Part time
Compressed hours

A 40% in-office attendance requirement can be spread across the month to accommodate diverse working patterns, such as the flexibility to purchase a weekly train ticket for certain weeks.

A day in the role

A typical day would probably start with the team stand-up meeting where you'll discuss your workload for the current sprint and seek help addressing any blockers that you face. Next, you'll likely have some migration work to deliver the new solution for waves of colleagues across the Bank. After that, you'll draft and raise a change request through the Bank's formal processes to change or update controls in Purview the following week. If you're in the office, you may grab lunch in the canteen with some of your colleagues. In the afternoon, you'll tackle a support call from a pilot user who is having issues with saving a document. Once you've sorted that call, you'll document the fix so that other colleagues better understand the service. The rest of the afternoon could be spent doing some research on refining the migration process or working with business analysts to understand business requirements.

Your responsibilities may adapt depending on the needs of the team. These could also include:

Engaging with external, 3rd party vendors for support purposes, and ensuring we drive value from our services.
Providing training to end-users and internal SharePoint champions on best practices, features, and functionality.
Empowering business users to meet their own via migrating their own content or using tools like PowerApps / Power Platform.
Participating in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the performance and usability of SharePoint environments.
Ensuring there is visibility of our solutions, using reporting and monitoring tools.
BAU operational support for SharePoint, Teams, and other M365 products. This could include resolving requests, incidents and problems when on support.

Role Requirements:

Minimum Criteria

We are interested in hearing from candidates with demonstrable experience of the following:

The M365 suite of applications including:
Microsoft Teams and SharePoint Online, including:
Strong knowledge of Teams and SharePoint architecture, covering governance, security models / permissions, Teams channels, content management, search, and user access controls across all Microsoft services
OneDrive for Business
Configuring, maintaining and performing backups and restoration for Teams and SharePoint Online.
Practical expertise in the use of PowerShell.

Essential Criteria

We're looking for someone who:

Embodies our values and is a role model to others, putting diversity and inclusion first.
Collaborates well with others, forming effective working relationships with excellent communication skills to engage with stakeholders and technical teams.
Brings a high level of integrity, organisation and self-motivation with a desire for self-improvement to the role.
Has good interpersonal and communication skills, empowering others by openly sharing their knowledge and expertise, including crafting concise and informative documentation for IT colleagues and end users.
Has excellent attention to detail.
Displays a positive 'can-do' demeanour and the ability to work well under pressure.
Is willing to embrace our Service First culture.

Desirable Criteria

It would also be beneficial, but not necessary, to have Microsoft accreditation and/or demonstrable experience of the following:

Document and Records Management.
Management of Azure applications and updates including User Management and M365 Groups knowledge.
Experience of using SharePoint migration tools.
Understanding of data security and compliance standards in cloud environments.
Using Agile ways of working with delivery of tasks in a sprint methodology.
Delivering project work to deadlines and to a high standard.
Enterprise Search.
AIP/MIP.
DRM.
Entra ID.
Windows Server administration and IIS knowledge/skills - assist/support developers with hosting IIS sites and dealing with different issues/maintenance
Microsoft Purview, including:
Record Labels and Policies
Information Protection Sensitivity Labels
Experience in the implementation of life cycling, retention and security policies.
eDiscovery
Power Platform, including:
Administration of Power Platform environments
Power Automate Flows / Power Apps
Azure services, including:
Entra ID
Subscriptions
Networking - Virtual Networks, Subnets, Network Security Groups, Azure Firewall
Key Vaults
Storage Accounts
App Services
Function Apps
Azure SQL
Data Gateway
Azure DevOps Pipelines for CI/CD

This role is being offered as a fixed-term contract to end February 2026.

Our Approach to Inclusion

The Bank values diversity, equity and inclusion. We play a key role in maintaining monetary and financial stability, and to do that effectively, we believe we need a workforce that reflects the society we serve.

At the Bank of England, we want all colleagues to feel valued and respected, so we're working hard to build an inclusive culture which supports people from all backgrounds and communities to be at their best at work. We celebrate all forms of diversity, including (but not limited to) age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, race, religion, sexual orientation and socioeconomic status. We believe that it's by drawing on different perspectives and experiences that we'll continue to make the best decisions for the public.

As part of our commitment to expand our presence across the UK, this role is based in Leeds.

We welcome applications from individuals who work flexibly, including job shares and part time working patterns. We've also partnered with external organisations to support us in making adjustments for candidates and employees in the recruitment process where they're needed.

For most roles where work can be carried out at home, we aim for colleagues to spend half of their time in the office, with a minimum of 40% per month. Subject to that minimum requirement, individuals and managers should work together to find what works best for them, their team and stakeholders.

Finally, we're proud to be a member of the Disability Confident Scheme. If you wish to apply under this scheme, you should check the box in the 'Candidate Personal Information' under the 'Disability Confident Scheme' section of the application.

Salary and Benefits Information

We encourage flexible working, part time working and job share arrangements. Part time salary and benefits will be on a pro-rated basis as appropriate.

We offer a salary as follows:

Leeds circa £36,400 to £40,950

In addition, we also offer a comprehensive benefits package as detailed below:

A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked. There is the option to increase your pension (to 1/50th) or decrease (to 1/120th) in exchange for salary through our flexible benefits programme each year.
A discretionary performance award based on a current award pool.
A 8% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits.
26 days' annual leave with option to buy up to 12 additional days through flexible benefits.
Private medical insurance and income protection.

National Security Vetting Process

Employment in this role will be subject to the National Security Vetting clearance process (and typically can take between 6 to 12 weeks post offer) and the passing of additional Bank security checks in accordance with the Bank policy. Further information regarding the vetting and security clearance requirements for the role will be provided to the successful applicant, and information about how the Bank processes personal data for these purposes, is set out in the Bank's Privacy Notice.

The Bank of England welcomes applications from all candidates, but as a UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) approved sponsor, we have a responsibility to comply with the Immigration Rules and guidance. As such, our ability to employ individuals who require sponsorship for immigration purposes is limited. The Bank cannot guarantee that you and / or the role you are applying for will be eligible for sponsorship and that any application made to UKVI will be successful. Eligibility will therefore be considered on a case by case basis.

The Application Process

Important: Please ensure that you complete the 'work history' section and answer ALL the application questions fully. All candidate applications are anonymised to ensure that our hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information, including your CV, when reviewing your application details at the screening stage. It's therefore really important that you fill out the work history and application form questions, as your answers will form a critical part of the initial selection process.

This role closes on 6 May 2025.

The assessment process will likely comprise of two interview stages, one focussed on soft skills and competencies, the other on technical expertise.

Please apply online, ensuring that you complete your work history and answer ALL the application questions fully and in detail as your application will not be considered if all mandatory questions are not fully completed.

Title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
Description:
Job Summary

We have an opportunity for an experienced Senior Data Platform Engineer to provide expertise in building data processing frameworks to handle business critical data. Reporting to the Data Platform Manager you will work as part of a team of platform engineers, as subject matter experts, leading on the design, implementation and testing of high quality, robust data platforms. Working in conjunction with the Data Delivery and Quality Assurance teams to provide quality solutions for the Data Science and Reporting and Analytics functions. The Senior Data Platform Engineer will lead on ensuring solutions are produced to the highest possible standard and within industry standards.

Main duties of the job

Please ensure that you read the Job Description carefully and that you address each of the requirements of the post in the Person Specification. Your application will be assessed against these criteria. Your online application should relate to the specific position you are applying for and you are expected to highlight examples and achievements that demonstrate the competencies outlined in the Job Description and from the Job Advert in your application form. Try to keep it structured and to the point. We are a Disability Confident Employer and welcome applications from candidates with a disability. If your application meets the minimum criteria for the vacancy as set out in the person specification, you are guaranteed an interview. Please note: If you require a Visa to work in the UK, NHS Resolution is currently unable to support any sponsorship requests.

About Us

NHS Resolution (NHSR) is a not-for-profit part of the NHS working for health care providers to resolve claims fairly and to share learning across the NHS and beyond. We provide a supportive environment for our staff with specialist training and the opportunity for personal development.

Date posted

17 April 2025

Pay scheme

Agenda for change

Band

Band 7

Salary

£46,148 to £52,809 a year

Contract

Permanent

Working pattern

Full-time, Flexible working

Reference number

000094

Job locations

Leeds, London, Hybrid or Home working

Leeds, England, United Kingdom

Yorkshire

LS1 4AP

Job Description

Job responsibilities

We have an opportunity for an experienced Senior Data Platform Engineer to provide expertise in building data processing frameworks to handle business critical data.

Reporting to the Data Platform Manager you will work as part of a team of platform engineers, as subject matter experts, leading on the design, implementation and testing of high quality, robust data platforms. Working in conjunction with the Data Delivery and Quality Assurance teams to provide quality solutions for the Data Science and Reporting and Analytics functions.

The Senior Data Platform Engineer will lead on ensuring solutions are produced to the highest possible standard and within industry standards.

What You Will Be Doing:


Develop the data platform on Azure, using advanced T-SQL, Azure pipelines, and PySpark within Azure Synapse to produce the robust, reliable ETL/ELT processes that provide data for NHSR’s reporting, analytical, and data science functions.
Play a pivotal role in the transition to our cloud-based data platform in Azure.
Work closely with the Quality Assurance and Data Delivery teams to provide highly accurate and reliable data.
Act as an expert within our Azure DevOps CI/CD development framework.
Manage and maintain our legacy data platform during the transition to the cloud.
Support colleagues on technical matters, including the complex data sets available to the organisation.


What You’ll Bring:


Expert level knowledge of and experience with Azure data platform is required
Advanced level knowledge of and experience with Python for data engineering is required
Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with other teams to improve ways of working
Extensive experience of complex SQL code to include development of scripts, functions, and procedures
Ability to work autonomously daily, within broad occupational policies and targets and meet with manager regularly to discuss progress, complex issues, or areas of concern


At NHS Resolution (NHSR), we pride ourselves on recruiting talented individuals from a wide array of professional backgrounds. While many of our team members come from the NHS, we also welcome expertise from insurance companies, legal firms, technology sectors, and everything in between. Our commitment to diversity means we value the unique perspectives and experiences that individuals from all walks of life bring to our organisation. By fostering an inclusive environment, we ensure that our team reflects the rich diversity of the communities we serve.

Who We Are:

NHS Resolution is an Arm’s Length Body of the Department of Health & Social Care. As a not for profit part of the NHS, our purpose is to provide expertise to the NHS to resolve concerns fairly, share learning for improvement and preserve resources for patients. We have four key service areas:


Claims Management: delivering expertise in handling clinical and non-clinical claims to members of our Indemnity Schemes.
Practitioner Performance Advice: providing advice, support and interventions in relation to concerns about the individual performance of Doctors, Dentists and Pharmacists.
Primary Care Appeals: offering an impartial tribunal service for the fair handling of Primary Care contracting services.
Safety and Learning: supporting the NHS to better understand and learn from claims, concerns and disputes; to target safety activity while sharing learning across the NHS.


Please see our careers site for further details about us.

Additional Information:

Please ensure that you read the Job Description carefully and that you address each of the requirements of the post in the Person Specification. Your application will be assessed against these criteria. Your online application should relate to the specific position you are applying for and you are expected to highlight examples and achievements that demonstrate the competencies outlined in the Job Description and from the Job Advert in your application form. If your application meets the minimum criteria for the vacancy as set out in the person specification, you are guaranteed an interview. Please note: If you require a Visa to work in the UK, NHS Resolution is currently unable to support any sponsorship requests.

About Us

NHS Resolution (NHSR) is a not-for-profit part of the NHS working for health care providers to resolve claims fairly and to share learning across the NHS and beyond. We provide a supportive environment for our staff with specialist training and the opportunity for personal development.

Job Description

Job responsibilities

We have an opportunity for an experienced Senior Data Platform Engineer to provide expertise in building data processing frameworks to handle business critical data.

Reporting to the Data Platform Manager you will work as part of a team of platform engineers, as subject matter experts, leading on the design, implementation and testing of high quality, robust data platforms. Working in conjunction with the Data Delivery and Quality Assurance teams to provide quality solutions for the Data Science and Reporting and Analytics functions.

The Senior Data Platform Engineer will lead on ensuring solutions are produced to the highest possible standard and within industry standards.

What You Will Be Doing:

  • Develop the data platform on Azure, using advanced T-SQL, Azure pipelines, and PySpark within Azure Synapse to produce the robust, reliable ETL/ELT processes that provide data for NHSR’s reporting, analytical, and data science functions.
  • Play a pivotal role in the transition to our cloud-based data platform in Azure.
  • Work closely with the Quality Assurance and Data Delivery teams to provide highly accurate and reliable data.
  • Act as an expert within our Azure DevOps CI/CD development framework.
  • Manage and maintain our legacy data platform during the transition to the cloud.
  • Support colleagues on technical matters, including the complex data sets available to the organisation.

What You’ll Bring:

  • Expert level knowledge of and experience with Azure data platform is required
  • Advanced level knowledge of and experience with Python for data engineering is required
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with other teams to improve ways of working
  • Extensive experience of complex SQL code to include development of scripts, functions, and procedures
  • Ability to work autonomously daily, within broad occupational policies and targets and meet with manager regularly to discuss progress, complex issues, or areas of concern

At NHS Resolution (NHSR), we pride ourselves on recruiting talented individuals from a wide array of professional backgrounds. While many of our team members come from the NHS, we also welcome expertise from insurance companies, legal firms, technology sectors, and everything in between. Our commitment to diversity means we value the unique perspectives and experiences that individuals from all walks of life bring to our organisation. By fostering an inclusive environment, we ensure that our team reflects the rich diversity of the communities we serve.

Who We Are:

NHS Resolution is an Arm’s Length Body of the Department of Health & Social Care. As a not for profit part of the NHS, our purpose is to provide expertise to the NHS to resolve concerns fairly, share learning for improvement and preserve resources for patients. We have four key service areas:

  • Claims Management: delivering expertise in handling clinical and non-clinical claims to members of our Indemnity Schemes.
  • Practitioner Performance Advice: providing advice, support and interventions in relation to concerns about the individual performance of Doctors, Dentists and Pharmacists.
  • Primary Care Appeals: offering an impartial tribunal service for the fair handling of Primary Care contracting services.
  • Safety and Learning: supporting the NHS to better understand and learn from claims, concerns and disputes; to target safety activity while sharing learning across the NHS.

Please see our careers site for further details about us.

Additional Information:

To apply please provide us with a covering letter explaining exactly what you will bring to this role and how you meet the essential criteria in terms of your background, experience and career achievements to date. As well as your CV listing detailed work history and job responsibilities.

This role offers flexible working with a possibility to work fully remotely or on a hybrid basis from our Leeds or London offices. If you are a homeworker there will be a requirement to travel to our London offices for meetings at least quarterly. Travel expenses are covered for this.

Title: Senior Finance Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Solera is a global leader in data and software services that strives to transform every touchpoint of the vehicle lifecycle into a connected digital experience. In addition, we provide products and services to protect life’s other most important assets: our homes and digital identities. Today, Solera processes over 300 million digital transactions annually for approximately 235,000 partners and customers in more than 90 countries. Our 6,500 team members foster an uncommon, innovative culture and are dedicated to successfully bringing the future to bear today through cognitive answers, insights, algorithms and automation. For more information, please visit solera.com.




The Role

The Senior FP&A Analyst support the North Europe Finance team to achieve short, medium and long-term strategic and financial goals. In this role you will serve as a key member of the Finance Team driving targets towards growth, expense optimization, financial/operational/sales analysis, key business partner to business stakeholders etc




What You’ll Do

Prepare and update periodic forecasts, annual budgets and long-term plans

Assist with the preparation of business performance reviews for senior management

Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators; identify opportunities for financial improvement and provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management.

Assist team with analyzing and updating financial models for specific projects

Work cross functionally to drive process improvements and automation

Support the development and improvement of new and existing management reports and input templates

Strong analytical thought process and problem-solving skills.

Ad hoc analysis in support of management decision-making

Act as a user expert of TM1 and MS Dynamics to efficiently manage reports from these systems and support source data for financial models

Manipulate large amounts of data from different sources and be able to tell a succinct story

Deliver quality work product within deadlines




What You’ll Bring

Must have proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office specifically in MS Excel (advanced-level preferred) and Power Point. Knowledge of Power BI is a Plus.

Ability to learn new technology quickly.

Ability to work with large amounts of data and to translate results into meaningful metrics.

Ability to work in fast-paced, high pressure environment, delivering with deadlines and handle multiple projects simultaneously with minimum supervision.

Attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks.

Effective written and oral communication skills as positions requires communicating with department heads and management.

Additional experience with financial/accounting systems is beneficial but not required.

Prior knowledge with TM1 beneficial but not required.

3-5 years of prior FP&A experience and a strong willingness to learn

Title: Senior Ethics & Independence Analyst
Description:
Senior Ethics & Independence Analyst




Base Location: Leeds, Manchester or Birmingham

The KPMG Business Services function is a cornerstone of our UK business. Operating from 20 UK locations and sitting with KPMG Central Services we do work that matters.

Within Central Services we are part of a community of experts across a wide range of critical activities who help grow, run, and protect KPMG in the UK.

From HR and Learning, Finance, Procurement, Facilities and Business Support, through to Risk and Legal, Corporate Affairs, and Sales and Marketing, our approach is focused on driving the improved performance of the firm, which we support with diligence and expertise.

KPMG is one of the world's largest and most respected consultancy businesses, we've supported the UK through times of war and peace, prosperity and recession, political and regulatory upheaval. We've proudly stood beside the institutions and businesses which make the UK what it is.




Why Join KPMG as a Senior Ethics & Independence Analyst

The Ethics and Independence (E&I) team are part of the Risk Operations Group (ROG) within the Operational Excellence Hub (OEH) which is responsible for monitoring the firm’s and its individuals’ compliance with the firm’s professional risk management and quality control policies, procedures, and guidance. Furthermore, the Group work with the wider Quality and Risk community and across the KPMG network to exchange knowledge, develop and improve processes and procedures in response to emerging regulatory, business, and other requirements.

The Personal E&I team are responsible for a number of processes and procedures in order to demonstrate oversight of compliance in accordance with firm/regulatory policy such as clearance of the firm’s personnel and third-party resource for on-boarding and issuing mandatory E&I training in line with global requirements. They provide guidance and advice to partners, firm’s personnel and third-party resource on personal independence matters and are the first point of contact for personal E&I related requests, completing the necessary research in order to escalate/ respond in accordance with firm/regulatory policy.




What will you be doing?

This role has responsibility for supporting the Assistant Manager with a focus on delivering excellent quality across our service catalogue. With the help of management, this role will support personal E&I activities with a right first-time approach and continuous improvement.

You will be responsible for helping train and coach the team to ensure full compliance with the regulations, policy and procedures relating to E&I. You will consult with relevant E&I colleagues assisting with queries and issues as they arise. Where lessons learnt are identified, you will root cause and help to improve processes by recommending and applying enhancements to increase understanding and quality.




Assisting the management team and providing SME support to the E&I team
Identify any issues in E&I tasks and ensure they are escalated and recorded in the correct manner, reporting to the Personal E&I manager
Assist with ongoing training and development of the Personal E&I team
Ensure tasks are completed in accordance with the applicable regulations and existing guidance and within the service level agreements
Assign relevant E&I tasks to the firm’s personnel and third-party resource and monitoring completion using firms internal training, compliance and HR systems and Microsoft Office
Have excellent working knowledge and comprehensive understanding of applicable personal independence rules
Responding to queries and clearing E&I exceptions based on personal independence requirements
Liaising with the onboarding team to help resolve any escalations and issues driving quality
Assisting with mailboxes and E&I helpline escalations and queries
Generating management reports and analytics
Assisting other E&I team members with wider compliance programmes, where required
Assisting the E&I manager with E&I related projects such as confirmation exception clearance




What will you need to do it?




Sound organisational and analytical skills with the ability to prioritise effectively
The ability and willingness to take personal responsibility and accountability for own work
Strong, supportive team-player able to train and coach the team
Provide second level quality checking support
Client-focused approach with a passion for delivering excellence
Excellent written and oral communication skills
The ability to interpret information and identify issues
The ability to work well under pressure
Extremely high level of attention to detail is essential
The ability to handle sensitive/confidential information appropriately
The confidence to challenge the status-quo and provide fresh ideas
Confident user of Microsoft Office applications
Prior working experience in personal compliance is desired but not essential

To discuss this or wider Central Services roles with our recruitment team, all you need to do is apply, create a profile, upload your CV and begin to make your mark with KPMG.




Find out more:

Within Central Services we have a range of divisions and specialisms. Click the links to find out more below:

Central Services (KBS) at KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/kpmg-business-services/
Inclusivity and KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/people-culture/being-inclusive/
KPMG Workability and Disability confidence: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/need-support-let-us-know/

For any additional support in applying, please click the links to find out more:

Applying to KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/
Tips for interview: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/application-advice/
KPMG values: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/our-values/

KPMG Locations and FAQ: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/faq/?category=Experienced+professionals

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Senior Python Developer

Salary - £55,000 - £70,000

Location – Leeds (once a week)




About the Company:

Our client is a purpose-driven digital services consultancy that combines human-centred design, data-informed insight, and software engineering to tackle complex challenges. They work closely with clients—including those in government, healthcare, and beyond—to design and deliver digital solutions that are as empathetic as they are effective.




The Role:

Are you an experienced Python developer seeking a meaningful role where your technical expertise can make a genuine difference? As a Senior Python Developer, you’ll play a key role in shaping and delivering high-quality digital solutions. You’ll work closely with designers, developers, and stakeholders to craft scalable, efficient systems that are accessible, user-friendly, and built to last.




Your responsibilities will include:

• Leading the technical delivery of projects, offering hands-on coding expertise and architectural insight

• Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design solutions that meet user needs and business goals

• Building, testing, and deploying cloud-native applications using modern frameworks and serverless infrastructure

• Supporting and mentoring team members, fostering a positive and growth-oriented engineering culture

• Representing the organisation in technical discussions, stakeholder meetings, and community engagement




Candidate Requirements:

• Advanced skills in Python

• Strong experience with AWS services, particularly in serverless environments

• Solid understanding of web technologies including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and libraries like React or Node.js

• Knowledge of API design, containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes), and microservices architecture

• Practical experience with infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation) and CI/CD processes

• A user-focused mindset and familiarity with agile methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban, or TDD




Benefits:

• Salary - £55,000 - £70,000

• Competitive, transparent salary

• 25 days holiday + UK public holidays

• 6% employer pension contribution

• Tailored benefits scheme covering health, wellbeing, travel, and more

• Life assurance and critical illness cover







For more information, please apply below or contact me directly.




Contact: 02077806706

Email: shay.campbell@anson.mccade.com

LinkedIn: Shay Campbell | LinkedIn

Senior Python Developer

Reference- AMC/SCA/SPD

As a Senior Python Developer, you’ll play a key role in shaping and delivering high-quality digital solutions. You’ll work closely with designers, developers, and stakeholders to craft scalable, efficient systems that are accessible, user-friendly, and built to last.


Your responsibilities will include:

• Leading the technical delivery of projects, offering hands-on coding expertise and architectural insight

• Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design solutions that meet user needs and business goals

• Building, testing, and deploying cloud-native applications using modern frameworks and serverless infrastructure

• Supporting and mentoring team members, fostering a positive and growth-oriented engineering culture

• Representing the organisation in technical discussions, stakeholder meetings, and community engagement


Candidate Requirements:

• Advanced skills in Python

• Strong experience with AWS services, particularly in serverless environments

• Solid understanding of web technologies including JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and libraries like React or Node.js

• Knowledge of API design, containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes), and microservices architecture

• Practical experience with infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation) and CI/CD processes

• A user-focused mindset and familiarity with agile methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban, or TDD


Benefits:

• Salary - £55,000 - £70,000

• Competitive, transparent salary

• 25 days holiday + UK public holidays

• 6% employer pension contribution

• Tailored benefits scheme covering health, wellbeing, travel, and more

• Life assurance and critical illness cover
